Commitment Title: Strengthened interaction and dialogue between the Jogorku Kenesh and the local communities
Short Title: Coordination between Parliament and Local Government
Short Title 中文: 議會和地方政府之間的協調
Full Text:
August 1, 2019 – September 31, 2020
Lead implementing agency: The Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic

Commitment description
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
Being a representative body of all sectors of society,
the Parliament represents the interests of all local
communities in the country. However, there are no
formalized and effective mechanisms to ensure the
coherence of interests of local communities with
interests of other parties in the Kyrgyz Republic.
Local communities and local self-governments do not
have a channel for the direct communication with the
Jogorku Kenesh to discuss the balance of interests in
respect to planned legislative decisions.
What is the commitment? Establishment of effective mechanisms of interaction
between the local community, local self-governments
and the Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic will
allow inclusion of interests of LSGs in adoption of the
NLAs. 

How will the commitment contribute to the resolution of the public problem?
Establishment of mechanisms for communicating
the needs and interests of local communities to the
Jogorku Kenesh will ensure the strengthening of the
accountability of the Parliament, as the Jogorku Kenesh
will take into account the interests of local communities
in the adoption of relevant policy decisions (NLAs),
and will also provide favorable conditions for the LSG
bodies to effectively engage in the dialogue with the
Jogorku Kenesh in the process of discussing draft laws
related to the interests of local communities.
Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values? Participation of citizens: Ensured active participation
of local communities and LSGs in the discussion of
some draft NLAs and national strategic documents
affecting their interests.

Additional information
Milestone Activity with a verifiable deliverable Budget

Task 1: Establishment of mechanisms for communicating the needs and interests of the local
communities to the Jogorku Kenesh through local self-government bodies (LSGs): development
and piloting of mechanisms, including regular meetings, etc.
1.1 Conduct a detailed analysis of the legislation
to identify the existing mechanisms of interaction
between local communities and LSGs with the
Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic in terms
of their effectiveness and applicability, as well as
develop possible options for interaction of local
communities and LSGs with the Parliament.

1.2 Selection and identification of priority
mechanisms for the interaction of local
communities and LSGs with the Jogorku Kenesh
(existing and proposed).

1.3 Discussion of mechanisms of interaction of
local communities and LGBs with stakeholders
(the Jogorku Kenesh, the Government, the state
bodies, LSGs, the expert community).

1.4 Draft a set of legal instruments introducing
changes and amendments to the legislation of
the Kyrgyz Republic (the Rules of Procedure
of the Jogorku Kenesh, the Law on NLAs,
the Law on LSGs, etc.) in order to strengthen
the proposed mechanisms and improve the
existing mechanisms of interaction between
local communities and LSGs with the Kyrgyz
Parliament.

Task 2: Development and presentation of a regular report on the impact of laws on LSGs by the
Union of LSGs to the Jogorku Kenesh
1.1 Development of the methodology, the status
of the Report on the impact of laws on LSG
bodies, as well as indicators.

1.2 Discussion of the developed Methodology
and the status of the Report on the impact of
laws on LSG structures, as well as indicators
with stakeholders (the Jogorku Kenesh, the
Government, the state bodies, LSGs, the expert
community).

1.3. Collection of necessary information, creation
of a working group, communication of queries.

1.4. Drafting the text of the Report and its
presentation to the Jogorku Kenesh.

1.5. The Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic
uses the Report to improve its oversight function.

Commitment Title: Simplification of procedures of access to the building of the Jogorku Kenesh for citizens and organizing excursions into the parliamentary building
Short Title: Access to Parliament Building for Citizens
Full Text:
September 01, 2019 – June 30, 2020

Lead implementing agency The Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic

Commitment description

What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
Despite the fact that according to the Rules of Procedure
of the Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic the
following provisions were drafted and adopted: “On the
procedure of presence of citizens and representatives
of legal entities at the meetings of the Jogorku Kenesh
of the Kyrgyz Republic and its bodies”; “On the use of
buildings, structures, residential office premises and
territories under the jurisdiction of the Jogorku Kenesh
the Kyrgyz Republic”; “On the permit regime” the access
of information about these procedures to the citizens
(Rules of Procedure, Article 145) and the admission
of citizens to the premises of the Jogorku Kenesh of
the Kyrgyz Republic remains cumbersome and not
transparent to the visitors.

What is the commitment? To develop a brief description of the procedure for
granting access to the building for the citizens with clear
requirements for each group of visitors and post these
documents on the website of the Parliament, as well as
launching an option on the website www.kenesh.kg to
accept online applications for attendance of the meetings
and entrance to the premises of the Jogorku Kenesh
to meet a certain MP and the opportunity to receive a
response to the mailbox or by SMS.

How will the commitment contribute to the resolution of the public problem?
Visitors of the Parliament premises will receive clear
instructions defining the procedures of entrance to the
building, and will be able to apply for attendance online,
which will enhance interaction of the citizens with the
Parliament and, as a result, improve the quality of the
parliamentary work.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
It leads to transparency and accountability of the
Jogorku Kenesh and broadens engagement of the
citizens in the work of the Parliament.

Additional information
Milestone Activity with a verifiable deliverable Budget

Task 1: Analysis of the current regulations on the admission of citizens to the premises of the
Jogorku Kenesh building (plenary session, meeting an MP, excursion) and discussion thereof with
the civil society
Analysis of the current regulations on the
access of citizens to the Jogorku Kenesh
premises (plenary session, reception of the MP,
excursion).
Discussed with the civil society in the Working
Group on the Open Parliament.

Task 2: Drafting and approval of the regulations on the admission of citizens to the Jogorku
Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic (to the plenary session, meeting an MP, excursion) with the
opportunity of obtaining an automatic pass through registration on the parliamentary website.

admission of citizens to the Jogorku Kenesh
of the Kyrgyz Republic (to the plenary session,
meeting an MP, field trip) with the opportunity
of obtaining an automatic pass through

A short version of the regulations prepared for

Publication of the provisions for posting on the

Development of an additional option on the
parliamentary website that allows the visitors
to leave an online application and receive an
answer through mailbox or by SMS.

Task 3: Development of procedures of access for excursion for Kyrgyz and foreign attendees in
the premises of the Jogorku Kenesh.

and foreign attendees in the premises of the
Jogorku Kenesh are drafted and approved.
Information about field trips is posted on the
parliamentary website.

Commitment Title: Improvement of the accountability of the Parliament to the public and better information on planned activities for the year (by factions and committees).

Commitment description
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
The JK of the KR still lacks a legal act that regulates what
information (not related to information protected by the
law) is subject to mandatory publication. This creates a
situation when the Parliament independently decides what
information or document to publish.

What is the commitment? Improved parliamentary accountability and better
information on planned activities for the year (by factions
and committees).

How will the commitment contribute to the resolution of the public problem?
Implementation of the right of citizens to access
information.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
It promotes the implementation of the right of citizens to
access information.

Jogorku Kenesh and discuss the information for an open publication with the civil society.

website and in the public domain;

Commitment Title:
Monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of the National Action Plan on building of the
Open Government by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic
(Governmental resolution No. 360-r dated October 16, 2018)
Full Text:
September 1, 2019 – August 31, 2020 

Lead implementing agency: The Jogorku Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic

Commitment description

What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
According to the semi-annual report of the Open
Government National Forum and results of the evaluation
of the implementation of the Resolution № 360-r dated
October 16, 2018, only 20% of the measures / actions of
the National Action Plan were implemented. Despite the
fact that the Forum is co-chaired by the Vice Prime Minister
of the Kyrgyz Republic, the executive authorities do not
implement their obligations in time. In this regard, it is
necessary to strengthen oversight functions of Parliament
of the Kyrgyz Republic as a legislative body to which the
Government of the Kyrgyz Republic and other state bodies
are accountable.

What is the commitment? 
The Jogorku Kenesh undertakes to monitor and evaluate
the implementation of the National Open Government
Action Plan by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic
(Resolution No. 360-r dated October 16, 2018).

How will the commitment contribute to solve the public problem?
The parliamentary monitoring and evaluation of the
implementation of the abovementioned Resolution No.
360-r dated October 16, 2018 by the state bodies will allow
to strengthen the control over the fulfillment of the assigned
obligations, accelerate the achievement of the expected
results of the NAP, attract public attention to the existing
problems to be solved in result of the implementation of
the NAP, and involve civil society in the process of public
monitoring.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
Transparency: Evaluation and monitoring by the Jogorku
Kenesh will facilitate the preparation of an alternative
report for the public.
Participation of citizens: Ensured participation of
citizens in the time of reporting by the state bodies
involved in the implementation of NAP obligations at the
sessions of the Jogorku Kenesh.

Additional information
Milestone Activity with a verifiable deliverable Budget

Task 1: Drafting the report
1.1 Establish a standing commission on the
OGP issues

1.2. Draft and approve the monitoring and
evaluation methodology.

1.2 Arrange a session of the Jogorku
Kenesh of the Kyrgyz Republic on the
implementation of Resolution No. 360-r of
October 16, 2018 by the Government and
other state bodies with the participation of
the public, mass media (live TV broadcast)
and representatives of the IRM, department
of the Open Government Partnership

1.3. Draft a report (annual and biennial
results).

1.4 Post the Report of the Jogorku Kenesh
on the parliamentary website.

1.5 Instruct the Government and other state
bodies to eliminate the identified deficiencies
based on the results of evaluation and
monitoring of the Jogorku Kenesh of the
Kyrgyz Republic.

1.6 Take adequate measures against
state agencies that failed to implement the
measures / actions arranged in the NAP.

Commitment Title: Single portal for the drafting of legislative and development planning documents
Short Title: Portal Drafting Legislature and Development of Planning Documents
Short Title 中文: 門戶網站起草立法和製定規劃文件
Full Text:
Status quo: The decision making process is complicated, and, due to that, hardly transparent and not easily accessible for the public. This places limitations on public engagement. the main objective is to Make easier and increase civic participation in public administration processes through expanding possibilities for the use of e-participation tools. 

To this end, there are plans to develop and put into operation by the beginning of 2016 a joint portal for drafting of legislation and development planning documents. The portal is expected to enhance the transparency of the processes of document drafting and decision-making in the central government and local authorities, as well as making it easier for the general public to quickly obtain clear information on the legislation and development planning documents being drafted, and engage and participate in the drafting. The decision making process will be visible and accessible as a whole, from the idea to making the final decision. 

The general public will have opportunities for presenting their proposals on changes in legislation or administrative practice, as well as for following the progress of draft legislation through all the stages until the adoption and directly contributing their opinions.
column17: LV0019 門戶網站起草立法和製定規劃文件 Portal Drafting Legislature and Development of Planning Documents
Full Text 中文:
現況：決策過程複雜，且難以透明且不易為大眾所接受。這限制了公眾參與。主要目標是透過擴大使用電子參與工具的可能性，使公共管理過程變得更加容易並增加公民參與。 

為此，計劃在2016年初開發並投入運作一個用於起草立法和發展規劃文件的聯合入口網站。該入口網站有望提高中央和地方文件起草和決策過程的透明度，並使公眾更容易快速獲得有關正在起草的立法和發展規劃文件的明確信息，並參與起草。從想法到做出最終決定，整個決策過程將是可見且可訪問的。 

公眾將有機會提出有關立法或行政實踐變化的建議，並有機會關注立法草案直至通過的各個階段的進展情況並直接發表意見。
Lead Institution: State Chancellery
Supporting Institution(s): Ministry of Environmental Protection and Regional Development

Commitment Title: Provide a possibility for the online collection of signatures on referenda
Short Title: Online Collection of Signatures on Referenda
Full Text:
Status quo: It was possible for the residents of Latvia to initiate referenda and amendments to legislation by collecting signatures on paper, which then would need to be witnessed by a notary public. Thus far no possibilities existing of collecting the signatures online.
Amendments to the Law on National Referenda, Legislative Initiatives and the European Citizens Initiative envisage that as from 1 January 2015 people will also be able to sign online the initiatives on referenda and legislation – via the portal Latvija.lv, and online systems created by private entities. 
In addition to its primary purpose, the solution also offers an innovative and open approach – the principle of open interfaces. The Law and the subordinate Cabinet of Ministers regulations stipulate that also private entities are also able to devise and offer solutions for the collection of signatures online, provided their systems comply with security and technical requirements laid down by the state, and has been certified by a competent institution. 
The state provides a platform for the submission, checking and counting of votes submitted online.
 Main objective: The online collection of signatures for initiating referenda, offered as an e-service on the single state and local government portal www.latvija.lv, aims at providing more convenient and widely accessible possibilities for taking part in the legislative and referendum initiatives, thereby making it easier for people, incl. those staying abroad, to directly participate in democratic processes in their country.

column17: LV0047 促進青年和非政府組織的參與機會 Promote opportunities for participation of youth and NGOs

2.1.參與公共行政機會的溝通活動 在國家審計署的領導下，有針對性地開展公共資訊活動，以促進公眾對參與類型和參與形式的了解。至少一項針對年輕人的活動是與教育和科學部共同舉辦的 

2.2.關於參與部門和市政府的機會的溝通活動 各部會應向其目標群體和合作夥伴以及其公民和非政府組織解釋如何參與其工作和決策過程，強調參與和利用的好處酌情提供與整個公共行政相關的共同資訊和材料。 

2.3.非政府組織日 每年的非政府組織日，該行業都會與 SAO 合作組織活動，向民間社會介紹行業當前的活動以及合作和參與的機會。

2.4.拉脫維亞和歐洲層面的青年參與決策技能，包括更新青年議會和加強青年對地方和區域當局大會的參與 

2.5.透過鼓勵年輕人獲得一系列技能、金融知識和環境責任，在包括地方當局在內的學校實施參與式預算

Short Title: Make legislative process more transparent and participatory
Short Title 中文: 使立法過程更加透明和參與
Full Text: 7.1 Increase transparency in the legislative process; and 7.2 Increase citizen participation in public policymaking The commitment aims to provide citizens with information to help them better understand which bills and laws will be voted upon. It will create spaces for public hearings, citizen engagement on draft legislation, and relevant advocacy campaigns. The following milestones will be reached to fulfill the commitment: 1. Track status of bills in the House of Representatives and Senate through a central database which lists all bills under consideration; 1.1 Provide information on the progress of bills, the sponsor of each bill and who has voted for each bill; 1.2 Publish ongoing results and analysis in quarterly reports and online; The commitment will increase participation by providing opportunity for citizens and civil society organizations to track, support and organize around the legislative processes. It will increase transparency by opening the parliamentary process to public scrutiny. Milestone Activity With a Verifiable Deliverable Deadline: Responsible agency 1. Track the status of bills in the House of Representatives and Senate through central database 1.1 Publish the full text of the (draft) bill as well as information on the progress, sponsors, and who has voted for each bill. Begins January 2021 and ongoing until December 2022 National Legislature 1.2 Publish results and analysis in quarterly reports and online through a searchable database. Begins January 2021 and ongoing until December 2022 National Legislature 2. Short Title 中文: 評估決定草案的影響並將結果公開
Full Text:
Status quo and problem addressed by the commitment Article 15 of the Law on Legislative Framework provides that when drawing up a draft legal act which provides for regulation of previously unregulated relations, also whereby legal regulation is substantially amended, assessment of the effect of envisaged legal regulation must be carried out. The comprehensiveness of this assessment must be proportionate to the likely consequences of the envisaged legal regulation. According to Article 15(3) of the Law on Legislative Framework, the results of assessment of the effect of envisaged legal regulation provided for in a draft law or another draft legal act of the Seimas shall be presented in an explanatory note or a separate document, e.g. following the Regulatory impact assessment guidelines, the results of the impact assessment may be presented in a regulatory impact assessment certificate. Also, following Articles 21.2 and 38.1 of the Rules of Procedure of the Government of the Republic of Lithuania, the letter (submission) submitting a draft legislation for feedback or for Government’s consideration must specify the problem to be addressed through the legislative proposal, the substance of regulation proposed through legislative proposal: solution of the issue (solution measures), solution costs, benefits and/or expected outcomes. Information must be concise, the problem to be addressed must be substantiated by data, the costs, and benefits of the implementation of the proposed solution must be substantiated by quantitative and/or qualitative assessments. All draft legislation and accompanying documentation (submission, explanatory note, regulatory impact assessment certificate, etc.) must be published in the Legal Acts Information System (in Lithuanian: TAIS), which is free and accessible to all the people and stakeholders. Hence, impact assessment of legislative proposals is available to the public at large, including academic and business communities and all the stakeholders. However, such publication of results of the assessment of the potential regulatory impact is not always acceptable to the public, so there is a need to publicise certain Government decisions in a more publicly acceptable and comprehensible form. The Government can approve up to 1.400 different decisions per year, which greatly differ in terms of their scope and the diversity of matters to be regulated but also in terms of their significance (as legislation is improved and amended also in editorial and technical terms) and the extent of possible consequences. For example, only about 170 from 1.400 of annual average of Government-approved decisions are related to the approval of relevant draft packages. As we know, all the key provisions of state-regulated societal relations must be consolidated in law, hence, presumably it would be best to find ways to inform the public in simple and clear language about positive and/or negative consequences of key laws that are or will be deliberated by the Government. Every six months, the Government selects, from its legislative plan, draft legislation that can potentially have greater impact. Projects are selected on the basis of specific greater impact criteria agreed by the Government. The number of such projects ranges on average from 8 to 10 in six months. Given that greater impact legislation is selected, it is appropriate that during public consultations and/or adoption of such legislation the public is informed in greater detail and in a more comprehensible and accessible manner about the expected benefits and consequences. It would also be appropriate to store and publicise the results of impact assessments of the selected greater-impact legislation in one place making them accessible to the general public and academia, as well as to all the stakeholders. 

Problem solution/commitment Develop a mechanism for presenting the expected benefits and potential consequences of Government decisions that may have a considerable impact on society, in full or in part, or on certain specific target groups in a comprehensible and publicly acceptable manner. 

Main objective Provide clear and comprehensible public information about the expected benefits and costs of potentially greater-impact legislation under Government’s consideration, and underlying reasons for the specific decisions. 

How will the commitment contribute to the public problem? The mechanism for presenting the expected benefits and potential consequences of Government decisions that may have a considerable impact on society in a simple and publicly accessible and convenient manner will enable public access to and better understanding of Government decisions and their expected benefits and consequences after enactment. The introduction of standardised publicity of the benefits and consequences of the proposed regulation is expected to lead to a more cautious approach by law-drafting civil servants in their assessment and documentation of potential benefits and consequences for the general public or certain target groups. 

What steps will be taken towards this objective? Distribute over time planned steps and expected outcomes 
Step and its description Expected practical outcome Start date End date 1. Develop a mechanism (process) for informing the public about expected benefits and consequences of potentially greater-impact legislation under Government’s deliberation. The mechanism should cover the responsibilities and duties of the participants in the process (Office of the Government and ministries), deadlines, ways of sharing information, etc. Process ready (described) as to who, when, and in what way disseminates information to the public about the expected benefits and consequences of potentially greater-impact legislation under Government’s deliberation 01/03/2021 01/05/2021 2. Develop a template for a press release (or other chosen method) to provide information to the public in a uniform manner. The template should set out the requirements and clearly structure the content of the information to be published. Public relations staff should be involved in the development of the template Template for a press release (or other chosen method) agreed between the Office of the Government and ministries 01/05/2021 01/07/2021 3. Present the results of steps 1 and 2 to decision makers A decision made to organise public information about 01/07/2021 01/09/2021 expected benefits and consequences of potentially greater-impact legislation under Government’s deliberation in the proposed manner 4. Publish the results of the assessment of greater-impact legislation on My Government portal. Publish structurally in one place the results of impact assessments Anyone interested now has easier access to the results of the impact assessments of potentially greaterimpact legislation 31/01/2021 31/01/2022 and onwards 

How is the commitment relevant to the values of transparency, accountability, and civic participation? The commitment will increase the dissemination of information on the expected benefits and consequences of greater-impact legislation under Government’s deliberation to the public and certain target groups, and it will directly contribute to increasing public accountability and transparency in decision-making. Simpler and clearer information to the public about potential benefits and costs of Government decisions will help the public to better understand and judge decisions and discuss their reasonableness. The implementation of the commitment can encourage civil servants, who draft legislation on publicly relevant issues, to carry out public consultations during the decision-making phase, which would contribute to public involvement in public governance and public policy solutions.
column17: LT0032 評估決定草案的影響並將結果公開 Assessing Impact of Draft Decisions and Making the Results Publicly Available
Full Text 中文:
現況與承諾解決的問題 《立法框架法》第 15 條規定，在起草法律草案時，對以前未規範的關係作出規定，並對法律規定進行實質性修改，應評估設想的法律規定的效果必須進行。這種評估的全面性必須與設想的法律監管的可能後果相稱。根據《立法框架法》第 15 條第 3 款，對法律草案或國會其他法律法案草案中規定的設想的法律規定的效果的評估結果應以解釋性說明或單獨文件的形式提出，例如根據監理影響評估指南，影響評估的結果可以在監理影響評估證書中列出。此外，根據立陶宛共和國政府議事規則第 21.2 條和第 38.1 條，提交立法草案供反饋或供政府審議的信函（提交材料）必須具體說明立法提案要解決的問題、實質內容通過立法提案提出的監管：問題的解決方案（解決措施）、解決方案成本、效益和/或預期結果。資訊必須簡潔，要解決的問題必須由數據證實，實施建議解決方案的成本和效益必須由定量和/或定性評估來證實。所有立法草案和隨附文件（提交資料、解釋性說明、監管影響評估證書等）必須在法律行為資訊系統（立陶宛語：TAIS）中發布，該系統對所有人員和利益相關者免費開放。因此，立法提案的影響評估可供廣大公眾使用，包括學術界、商界和所有利害關係人。然而，這種潛在監管影響評估結果的公佈並不總是能為公眾所接受，因此有必要以更公眾可以接受和理解的形式公佈某些政府決定。政府每年可以批准多達 1,400 項不同的決定，這些決定的範圍和監管事項的多樣性以及其重要性（隨著立法在編輯和技術方面的完善和修訂）都有很大差異，可能後果的程度。例如，在政府每年平均批准的 1,400 項決策中，只有大約 170 項與相關一攬子草案的批准有關。眾所周知，國家規範的社會關係的所有關鍵條款都必須在法律中得到鞏固，因此，最好想辦法以簡單明了的語言向公眾告知關鍵法律的積極和/或消極後果政府正在或將會審議。每六個月，政府就會從立法計畫中選出可能產生更大影響的立法草案。項目是根據政府同意的具體的更大影響標準來選擇的。六個月內此類項目的數量平均為 8 至 10 個。鑑於選擇了影響更大的立法，在公眾諮詢和/或通過此類立法期間，適當地讓公眾更詳細、更容易理解和更容易了解預期的好處和後果。還應該將選定的影響更大的立法的影響評估結果存儲和公佈在一個地方，使公眾和學術界以及所有利益相關者都可以獲得這些結果。 

問題解決/承諾建立一種機制，以可理解和公眾可接受的方式呈現可能對社會產生全部或部分相當大影響的政府決策的預期效益和潛在後果，或對某些特定目標群體產生相當大的影響。 

主要目標 提供清晰易懂的公共訊息，說明政府考慮的潛在更大影響立法的預期效益和成本，以及具體決定的根本原因。 

該承諾將如何解決公共問題？以簡單、公眾可獲取和方便的方式呈現可能對社會產生重大影響的政府決策的預期效益和潛在後果的機制，將使公眾能夠了解和更好地理解政府決策及其頒布後的預期效益和後果。對擬議法規的好處和後果進行標準化宣傳預計將導致法律起草公務員在評估和記錄對公眾或某些目標群體的潛在好處和後果時採取更加謹慎的態度。 

為實現這一目標將採取哪些措施？隨著時間的推移分配計劃的步驟和預期的結果 
步驟及其描述 預期實際成果 開始日期 結束日期 1. 制定一種機制（流程），讓公眾了解政府審議中可能產生更大影響的立法的預期效益和後果。此機制應涵蓋流程參與者（政府辦公室和部會）的責任和義務、截止日期、共享資訊的方式等。公眾介紹政府審議中可能產生更大影響的立法的預期效益和後果01/03/2021 01/05/2021 2. 制定新聞稿範本（或其他選定的方法），以統一的方式。模板應列出要求並清晰地建立要發布的資訊的內容。公共關係人員應參與範本的發展 政府辦公室和各部會商定的新聞稿範本（或其他選擇的方法） 01/05/2021 01/07/2021 3. 展示步驟 1 的結果2 致決策者決定組織有關01 /07/2021 01/09/2021 政府按擬議方式審議的可能具有更大影響力的立法的預期效益和後果的公共信息4. 公佈更大影響力立法的評估結果-影響“我的政府”門戶網站上的立法。在一個地方結構性地發布影響評估結果 任何有興趣的人現在都可以更輕鬆地獲取潛在更大影響立法的影響評估結果 2021年1月31日 2022年1月31日及以後 

該承諾與透明度、問責制和公民參與的價值觀有何關係？這項承諾將加強向公眾和某些目標群體傳播有關政府審議中影響力更大的立法的預期效益和後果的信息，並將直接有助於提高公共問責制和決策透明度。向公眾提供有關政府決策的潛在收益和成本的更簡單、更清晰的信息，將有助於公眾更好地理解和判斷決策並討論其合理性。該承諾的落實可以鼓勵負責起草公共相關問題的立法的公務員在決策階段開展公眾諮詢，這將有助於公眾參與公共治理和公共政策解決方案。
Lead Institution: Office of the Government
Supporting Institution(s): Public Relations Unit, Office of the Government Open Government Group, Office of the Government Ministerial units in charge of public relations Ministerial sector-specific units involved in drafting of greaterimpact legislation; Where appropriate, public consultations on individual actions may take place.

Commitment Title: Streamlining the legislative decision-making process at the institutional and government levels and establishing a common framework for legislative oversight
Full Text:
Brief description of the action The objective is to establish well-structured and high-quality legislative processes that facilitate public consultation and evidence-based decision-making

Key challenge addressed 

Absence of systematic, coherent, evidence-based, and transparent legislative processes. Despite the adoption of all necessary regulatory measures, their practical implementation remains scarce. This context offers minimal opportunities for the engagement and participation of civil society and NGOs. Stakeholders are involved either belatedly or not at all in project preparation, often due to tight deadlines, limited communication channels, and unclear drafting stages. Furthermore, the means for citizen involvement and their tangible impact 21 on decision-making remain ambiguous. Engagement continues as insufficient, ineffective, and often superficial. 

The root causes for the problem 

The causes manifest themselves across various dimensions: 

Inconsistent legislative processes | As per the 2018 National Audit Office audit report, approximately 50% of draft legislation is rushed through or adopted with urgency.13 Although the proportion of such documents has nearly halved during the 2020-2024 parliamentary term (29.14% in 2016-2020 to compare with 15.96% in 2020-2024), stakeholders argue that the legislative process continues to operate in an ad hoc manner. Public consultations in the pre-legislative phases are rare, as solutions are often predetermined without comprehensive engagement.14 It is also important that other legislation, including regulatory orders of ministers and bodies subordinate to ministries, are not properly and consistently coordinated with the authorities concerned. Where the authorities concerned have not been identified, the draft order is not published on the Draft Legislation Information System of the Seimas (TAIS) and the public is not given the opportunity to react to it. In this scenario, documents are signed without public consultation, and legislative procedures fail to adhere to the principles of openness and transparency, neglecting to guarantee public input in the absence of alternative forms of consultation. In practice, the draft of any regulatory act (order) should ideally be published in the TAIS before adoption, allowing for consultations and feedback. 

The legislative initiative institute is practically unimplementable | The legislative initiative institute is seldom put to practice, even though the Law on Legislative Framework provides for it. It remains underutilized and often misunderstood by institutions, resulting in missed opportunities for obtaining pertinent legislative information and preparing for further meaningful public consultations. Stakeholder institutions, particularly in the non- governmental sector, struggle to anticipate when legislative initiatives will be enacted, hindering their ability to prepare and respond effectively. 

Lack of data utilisation in public sector decision-making | The public sector is still facing challenges related to the lack of open data sets, data quality, and lack of expertise among public sector personnel. Considering these factors, data-driven decisions may still rely on erroneous information and result in incorrect solutions. 

Action description 

Previous solution: In 2021, attempts were made to regulate and standardize ministerial legislative process by making the provisions of the Government’s Rules of Procedure apply mutatis mutandis to legislation, but there has been no support from the ministries. 

Planned solution/action: 

Regulatory changes to the ministerial legislative process | The aim is to ensure that the legislative standard, procedures, and deadlines set out in the Government’s Rules of Procedure are also applied at the level of ministries, government agencies and bodies subordinate to ministries in the drafting and collaborative consensus-building of legislation they adopt. Strengthened controls would ensure that drafts that lack proper consensus do not surface on a Government meeting agenda. 

Publication of the legislative plan | An upgrade of the TAIS is currently under preparation,. It will enable integrated monitoring of the entire drafting process from an initial idea to a final outcome. Until the TAIS is upgraded, the action will enable the publication and monitoring of the planned work of the Seimas session, and the drafting process of other key legislation (either on TAIS or on the My Government portal; the My Government portal operates on a different principle and it would not duplicate TAIS in essence, and the formats for presenting information on these two channels would also differ). 

Methodological guidance and education to ensure the practical implementation of a quality legislative process |The methodological guidance is a set of guidelines for public authorities and their staff who initiate and draft legislation. The methodological guidance would cover the whole legislative process: it would highlight the importance of each stage (including public consultation) for quality legislation and its sustainability, thereby structuring and synthesising the knowledge needed by drafters and other actors involved in the legislative process. The education campaign would focus on developing competences for data-driven and evidence-based decision-making. 

Stakeholder education | This action aims to facilitate meaningful involvement of stakeholders in legislative processes. It encompasses education initiatives, communication campaigns, and other activities designed to enhance awareness of the legislative process and opportunities for stakeholder engagement. A strong emphasis will be placed on equipping stakeholders with the skills to utilize available data for making well-informed recommendations for improved legislation. 

Intended outcomes 

The overarching goal is to ensure a systematic, cohesive, and transparent legislative process. Key deliverables: • Enhanced civic engagement in decision-making (measured by both the quantity and quality of legislative proposals). • Practical application of Methodological guidelines and exchange of best practices. • To measure the impact of this action, a monitoring indicator will be developed to show the proportion of correctly or incorrectly drafted legislation. It is also important to note that the actions will partially contribute to the intended outcomes for the development of the justice system under the 2022-2030 Development Programme run by the Ministry of Justice: • The proportion of laws subjected to ex-post evaluation out of the total number of laws adopted in 2020 and beyond (a deliverable for 2030: 3%) 

The role of the action in advancing openness 

How will the action contribute to increasing transparency, accountability, and public participation in decision- making? The Model for monitoring legislative process will enhance the transparency of legislative processes, enabling the public to follow the actual decision-making in progress. The data-driven legislative process will bolster the quality and clarity of decision-making. Education campaigns will empower civil society to engage meaningfully in legislative processes. The action will pave the way for more transparent communication of ongoing processes.

Action implementation plan (Implementation step | Expected practical outcome | End date | Stakeholders)

Regulatory changes to the ministerial legislative process | Established requirements for the ministerial legislative process: | Q1 2024 | Responsible body – the Ministry of Justice Stakeholders – the Office of the Government, ministries 

Publication of the legislative plan | Ensured publication of the legislative plan | Q3 2024 | Responsible body – the Office of the Government Stakeholders – the Ministry of Justice, the Office of the Seimas 

Methodological guidance and education to ensure the practical implementation of a quality legislative process | The methodological guidance developed for public authorities and their staff to improve the quality of legislation; Training/consultation cycle for public authorities involved in drafting legislation | Q1 2024; Q3 2024 | Responsible body – the Ministry of Justice Stakeholders – the Office of the Government, ministries 

Stakeholder education | Education campaign on legislative participation held for stakeholder representatives | Q4 2025 | Responsible body – the Office of the Government Stakeholders – the Ministry of Justice, NGO and business organisations involved in legislative processes
column17: LT0033 簡化立法決策流程 Streamlining the Legislative Decision-Making Process
Full Text 中文:
行動簡述 目標是建立一個結構良好、高品質的立法程序，促進公眾諮詢和基於證據的決策

解決的關鍵挑戰 

缺乏系統、連貫、基於證據和透明的立法程序。儘管採取了所有必要的監管措施，但其實際實施仍然很少。這種背景為民間社會和非政府組織的參與提供了極少的機會。利害關係人要麼很晚才參與專案準備工作，要麼根本不參與專案準備工作，這通常是由於期限緊迫、溝通管道有限以及起草階段不明確。此外，公民參與的方式及其對決策的實際影響 21 仍然不明確。參與仍然不夠充分、無效，而且常常是膚淺的。 

問題的根本原因 

原因體現在各方面： 

立法程序不一致|根據2018 年國家審計署審計報告，約50% 的立法草案是匆忙通過或緊急通過的。 2020 年議會任期為29.14%）。立法前階段的公眾諮詢很少，因為解決方案往往是在沒有全面參與的情況下預先確定的。和一致的協調。如果有關當局尚未確定，則該命令草案不會在議會立法資訊草案系統（TAIS）上發布，公眾也沒有機會對此做出反應。在這種情況下，文件的簽署並沒有經過公眾協商，立法程序也沒有遵循公開透明的原則，在沒有其他形式的協商的情況下忽視了保障公眾的意見。在實踐中，任何監管法案（命令）的草案最好在通過前在 TAIS 中發布，以便進行諮詢和回饋。 

立法倡議實際上無法實施 |儘管《立法框架法》對此作出了規定，但立法倡議很少付諸實踐。它仍未被充分利用，並且經常被機構誤解，導致錯失獲得相關立法資訊和為進一步有意義的公眾諮詢做準備的機會。利害關係人機構，特別是非政府部門的利害關係人機構，很難預測立法措施何時頒布，阻礙了他們有效準備和應對的能力。 

公部門決策缺乏資料利用|公共部門仍面臨缺乏開放資料集、資料品質以及公共部門人員缺乏專業知識等挑戰。考慮到這些因素，數據驅動的決策可能仍然依賴錯誤的資訊並導致錯誤的解決方案。 

動作說明 

先前的解決方案：2021年曾嘗試透過比照《政府議事規則》的規定進行立法來規範和規範部級立法程序，但沒有得到各部會的支持。 

計劃的解決方案/行動： 

部級立法程序的監管變化|目的是確保政府議事規則中規定的立法標準、程序和最後期限也適用於各部會、政府機構和部會下屬機構在起草和協作建立所通過立法的共識時。加強控制將確保缺乏適當共識的草案不會出現在政府會議議程上。 

立法計劃公佈| TAIS 的升級目前正在準備中。它將能夠對從最初想法到最終結果的整個起草過程進行全面監控。在TAIS 升級之前，該行動將能夠發布和監督國會會議的計劃工作以及其他關鍵立法的起草過程（在TAIS 或“我的政府”門戶網站上；“我的政府”門戶網站在不同的平台上運行）原則上，它本質上不會重複TAIS，並且在這兩個管道上呈現資訊的格式也會有所不同）。 

確保高品質立法過程的實際實施的方法指導和教育|方法指導是為發起和起草立法的公共當局及其工作人員提供的一套指導方針。方法指南將涵蓋整個立法過程：它將強調每個階段（包括公眾諮詢）對於高品質立法及其可持續性的重要性，從而構建和綜合起草者和參與立法過程的其他參與者所需的知識。教育活動將著重於培養數據驅動和基於證據的決策能力。 

利害關係人教育|這項行動旨在促進利害關係人有意義地參與立法進程。它包括教育措施、溝通活動和其他旨在提高立法過程意識和利害關係人參與機會的活動。將重點關注為利害關係人提供利用現有數據的技能，為改進立法提出明智的建議。 

預期成果 

總體目標是確保立法過程的系統性、連貫性和透明度。主要成果： • 加強公民對決策的參與（透過立法提案的數量和品質來衡量）。 • 方法指南的實際應用和最佳實踐的溝通。 • 為了衡量此行動的影響，將制定一個監控指標來顯示正確或錯誤起草的立法的比例。另外值得注意的是，這些行動將部分有助於司法部實施的《2022-2030 年發展計畫》下司法系統發展的預期成果： • 接受事後評估的法律佔所有法律的比例。的法律總數（2030 年可交付成果：3%） 

該行動在促進開放方面的作用 

該行動將如何有助於提高決策的透明度、問責制和公眾參與？立法過程監督模式將提高立法過程的透明度，使公眾能夠了解正在進行的實際決策。數據驅動的立法過程將提高決策的品質和清晰度。教育活動將使民間社會能夠有意義地參與立法過程。該行動將為正在進行的流程進行更透明的溝通鋪平道路。

Commitment Title: Developing efficient collaborative legislation mechanisms.
Short Title 中文: 發展高效率的協作立法機制。
Full Text: Issue to be addressed: Citizens do not have a way to take part on a direct way in the specific definition of legislation developed by institutions, and in general not even in the main lines to be accomplished by the legislation. The few participation spaces available in some case for citizens are far away from the final definition of the policy that imply the legislative texts, causing a strong disconnection between citizens will and the decision being carried away by institutions. Primary objective: Achieving as the common and regular way to focus new regulations to include direct decision of citizens about the main goals and influence on the final texts. Short description: Developing a collaborative legislation system at Decide Madrid (including a previous debate phase and work on specific texts) and reaching a transverse and regular use at the City Council. OGP challenge: This commitment widely increases citizen participation, complementing the most common proposal and direct decision mechanisms that usually concern a minor number of decisions, starting to cover the space of regular legislation development that include most of the institution decisions. Ambition: Successfully implementation of a mechanism of this kind and proving that it works may result in a paradigmatic change on the way citizen participation and its limits are understood, opening the possibility to start taking into account seriously the existence of citizen participation mechanisms in the whole action of institutions, and not only in a minor and complementary way as it happens until now.
column17: MAD0005 發展高效率的協作立法機制。 Developing Efficient Collaborative Legislation Mechanisms.
Full Text 中文: 需要解決的問題：公民沒有辦法直接參與機構制定的立法的具體定義，一般來說甚至沒有參與立法要完成的主線。在某些情況下，公民可用的參與空間很少，與立法文本所暗示的政策的最終定義相去甚遠，導致公民意願與機構決策之間的嚴重脫節。主要目標：作為關注新法規的共同和常規方式，納入公民對主要目標的直接決定以及對最終文本的影響。簡短描述：在「馬德里決策」中製定協作立法系統（包括先前的辯論階段​​和具體文本的工作），並在市議會實現橫向和定期使用。 OGP 挑戰：這項承諾廣泛增加了公民參與，補充了通常涉及少數決策的最常見提案和直接決策機制，開始涵蓋包括大多數機構決策在內的常規立法發展空間。雄心：成功實施此類機制並證明其有效可能會導致對公民參與及其局限性的理解方式發生範式變化，從而為開始認真考慮整個公民參與機制的存在提供了可能性機構的行動，而且不僅僅是像迄今為止那樣以一種次要和補充的方式。

Lead implementing
agency/actor	Ministry of Finance, Public Property Agency

Commitment description
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?	Budgetary transparency and transparency of public procurement are high importance topics and are often discussed by the community –at-large.  Public procurement is a system where public needs meet private offers, and is a sphere with huge corruption risks. Good regulation and transparent procedures are necessary to minimize these risks, along with creating a market of tenders that makes government procurements effective and fosters competition at the same time. The citizen should be informed about use of public financial resources, understand the main budgetary documents and have access to data online. 
What is the commitment?	Commitment refers to improve budgetary transparency and transparency of public procurement. The commitment includes activities aiming at facilitating the understanding of the main budgetary documents, ensuring availability of data online, including via BOOST database and publication of reports about public procurement contracts monitoring.
How will the commitment contribute to solve the public problem?	The implementation of the commitment will contribute to an increased level of understanding of budgetary process and the ways public money is spent. 
Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?	•	Access to information;
•	Civic participation

承諾說明
該承諾將解決哪些公共問題？	預算透明度和公共採購透明度是非常重要的主題，並且經常被整個社會討論。  公共採購是公共需求滿足私人報價的系統，也是腐敗風險龐大的領域。為了最大限度地減少這些風險，需要良好的監管和透明的程序，同時也創建一個招標市場，使政府採購變得有效，同時促進競爭。公民應了解公共財政資源的使用情況，了解主要預算文件並能夠在線上取得數據。 
承諾是什麼？	承諾是指提高預算透明度和公共採購透明度。該承諾包括旨在促進主要預算文件的理解、確保線上數據可用性的活動，包括透過 BOOST 資料庫和發布有關公共採購合約監測的報告。

Theme: Open Data and Free Access to Information
Commitment Title: Improve digital accessibility standards for people with disabilities
Short Title: Improve Digital Accessibility Standards for People with Disabilities
Short Title 中文: 提高殘疾人士的數字無障礙標準
Full Text:
What public problem does the measure address? This measure responds to the problem of the still inconsistent application of standards of accessibility of materials from the websites of public institutions for persons with disabilities, and to the need to improve the existing platform for access to information, especially for visually impaired and deaf-mute people, as well as to improve the accessibility of information published on existing websites. The new Government portal, published in May 2021, represents the main communication channel of the Government and ministries and provides a new user and visual experience, which is reflected in the unified online appearance of ministries and state administration bodies. As stated in the Final Report on the Implementation of the National Action Plan for the Implementation of the OGP Initiative in Montenegro 2018-2020, the launch of the Government's new portal has for the first time ensured the full application of accessibility standards recommended by the Law on Electronic Administration, as well as the possibility of reading the content, and on based on consultations with organizations that represent the needs of PWDs. The portal meets the requirements of e-accessibility and a special menu has been implemented for improved content accessibility with control of contrast, font size, text spacing, animations, then a visual guide for easier reading, highlighting of links, compatibility with screen readers through the structure of the pages, as well as a special font that makes reading easier for people with dyslexia. On the basis of the Law on electronic administration, the Rulebook on accessibility standards was drawn up according to which state bodies, state administration bodies, state agencies, state funds and other holders of public authority (hereinafter referred to as: bodies) and local self-government bodies, local government bodies, special and public services, independent and regulatory bodies and legal and natural persons exercising public powers (hereinafter referred to as: other entities) that provide electronic administration services through a single information system, as well as through an information system that they establish themselves, must meet accessibility standards, and especially to persons with disabilities. A draft of the Instructions on the creation of electronically readable materials was prepared, but there was no training for employees, with the aim of training them for the creation of e-readable materials. On the other hand, the Digital Transformation Strategy 2022-2026 states that it is still necessary to work on increasing the number of accessible documents that are published on official websites. Also, the report of the Union of the Blind of Montenegro points to the still poor progress of public institutions in providing free access to information for visually impaired persons, contrary to the Law on Prohibition of Discrimination against Persons with Disabilities. Regarding the accessibility of information about the work of the legislative branch of government, the internet presentation of the Parliament of Montenegro, which was redesigned in March 2021, was adapted for software used by blind and partially sighted people, which was done in cooperation with the Union of the Blind of Montenegro. The accessibility of the site is guided by the Guidelines for ensuring the accessibility of online content 1.0, of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), and its functionality is based on cooperation with content authors, developers and associations of persons with disabilities, in order to meet AA standards. The next step, which would contribute to the additional improvement and simplification of access to parliamentary information, involves the provision of the "Accessibility" service with complete options as shortcuts for existing possibilities. 

What does this measure entail? The measure includes activities aimed at encouraging better application of digital accessibility standards for people with disabilities and especially facilitating access to information for visually impaired and deaf-mute people. 

In what way does the measure contribute to the solution of the identified public problem? It is expected that the new training cycle of officials on the effective application of digital accessibility standards for people with disabilities, as well as the introduction of a special platform for access to information for the visually impaired and deaf and mute, and the additional improvement of the accessibility of information published on the Internet presence of the Parliament of Montenegro, will further strengthen application of accessibility standards for persons with disabilities. 

Why is this measure relevant in relation to the values promoted through the OGP initiative? This measure is directly relevant to the values of transparency and openness of public administration, as well as the participation of citizens, especially vulnerable groups, in the creation of public policies. 

Additional information This measure is complementary to the goals and activities of the Digital Transformation Strategy of Montenegro 2022-2026, especially with the aim of e-inclusion where the use of digital platforms of public institutions by persons with disabilities is to be further improved. The trainings for civil servants planned by this NAP are complementary to the activities of the Action Plan of the Digital Transformation Strategy of Montenegro, which aim to improve digital knowledge and skills for sensitive groups of citizens (elderly population, people with disabilities, RE population, etc.) in the process of lifelong learning. By implementing this measure, a contribution is made to the realization of the goals of sustainable development, especially goal 10 (Reduce inequality between and within countries) and the related task 10.2 (Strengthen and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of everyone, regardless of age, gender, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status), as well as goal 16. (Peace, justice and strong institutions) and especially tasks 16.7. - ensuring responsible, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making and 16.10. -Ensure public access to information and protection of basic freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements. 

Budget 14.000 EUR

Activities 

9.1. Implement a new cycle of training for officials on the effective application of digital accessibility standards for people with disabilities Holder: Ministry of Public Administration, Directorate for Normative Regulation of the Public Administration System and Harmonization of Regulations and Human Resources Directorate Indicators for the implementation of activities: - conducted two trainings in 2023 - conducted two trainings in 2024 Required financial resources: EUR 4,000 Source of funding: Budget of Montenegro, donor funds February 2023 - December 2024

9.2. Improve the platform for access to information for visually impaired and deaf-mute people Holder: Ministry of Public Administration, Directorate for Normative Regulation of the Public Administration System and Harmonization of Regulations, Directorate for Infrastructure, Information Security, Digitization and e-Services Indicators for the implementation of activities: - conducted additional consultations with persons with disabilities on the design of the platform - specific needs of certain categories of PWDs, taking into account equal representation in terms of gender, socio-economic status, age, place of residence and the like - improve the design of the platform in 2023 - functional platform in 2024 Required financial resources: EUR 5,000 Source of funding: Budget of Montenegro, donor funds September 2023 - February 2024 

9.3. Improve the accessibility of information on the Internet presentation of the Parliament of Montenegro for visually impaired and deaf-mute people Holder: Parliament of Montenegro Indicators for the implementation of activities: - "Accessibility" service enabled on the Internet presentation of the Parliament - the content on the Internet presentation of the Parliament additionally complies with the guidelines for the accessibility of web content (WCAG 2.1) Required financial resources: EUR 5,000 Source of funding: Budget of Montenegro January 2023 - April 2023
column17: ME0071 提高殘疾人士的數字無障礙標準 Improve Digital Accessibility Standards for People with Disabilities
Full Text 中文:
該措施解決了什麼公共問題？這項措施針對的是公共機構網站殘疾人資料無障礙使用標準仍然不一致的問題，以及改進現有資訊獲取平台的需要，特別是針對視障和聾啞人的信息獲取平台。有網站上發布的資訊的可訪問性。 2021年5月發布的新政府入口網站代表了政府和各部會的主要溝通管道，提供了新的使用者和視覺體驗，這體現在各部會和國家行政機構統一的線上外觀。正如《2018-2020年黑山 OGP 倡議國家行動計劃實施情況最終報告》所述，政府新門戶網站的推出首次確保了該法建議的無障礙標準的充分實施電子管理以及閱讀內容的可能性，並基於與代表殘疾人需求的組織的協商。該入口網站滿足電子輔助功能的要求，並實施了一個特殊的選單，透過控制對比度、字體大小、文字間距、動畫來改進內容的可訪問性，然後是一個視覺指南，以便於閱讀、突出顯示連結、與螢幕閱讀器相容於頁面的結構，以及使患有閱讀障礙的人更容易閱讀的特殊字體。根據《電子化政府法》，制定了《無障礙標準規則手冊》，國家機關、國家行政機關、國家機關、國家基金和其他公共權力主體（以下簡稱：機關）和地方自治團體依據《無障礙標準規則手冊》制定了無障礙標準規則手冊。以下簡稱：其他實體）他們自己建立的資訊系統必須符合無障礙標準，特別是對身心障礙者而言。制定了關於創建電子可讀材料的指示草案，但沒有對員工進行培訓，旨在培訓他們創建電子可讀材料。另一方面，《2022-2026年數位轉型策略》指出，仍有必要努力增加官方網站上發布的可存取文件的數量。此外，黑山盲人聯盟的報告指出，公共機構在為視障者免費提供資訊方面進展仍然很差，這違反了《禁止歧視殘疾人法》。關於政府立法部門工作資訊的可取得性，黑山議會的網路演示於 2021 年 3 月重新設計，並針對盲人和弱視人士使用的軟體進行了改編，這是與黑山盲人聯盟。該網站的可訪問性遵循萬維網聯盟 (W3C) 的《確保在線內容 1.0 的可訪問性指南》，其功能基於與內容作者、開發者和殘疾人協會的合作，以便達到AA標準。下一步將有助於進一步改進和簡化議會資訊的獲取，包括提供「無障礙」服務，並提供完整的選項作為現有可能性的捷徑。 

這項措施意味著什麼？該措施包括旨在鼓勵殘疾人更好地應用數位無障礙標準，特別是促進視障者和聾啞人士獲取資訊的活動。 

該措施如何有助於解決已確定的公共問題？預計將針對殘疾人開展新的關於有效應用數位無障礙標準的官員培訓週期，並推出為視障者和聾啞人獲取資訊的特殊平台，並進一步改進黑山議會互聯網上發布的信息的無障礙性將進一步加強殘疾人士無障礙標準的實施。 

為什麼這項措施與 OGP 倡議所倡導的價值觀相關？這項措施與公共行政的透明度和開放性價值觀以及公民特別是弱勢群體參與公共政策制定直接相關。 

其他資訊 此措施是《2022-2026 年黑山數位轉型策略》目標和活動的補充，特別是為了實現電子包容性，即進一步改善身心障礙者對公共機構數位平台的使用。本國家行動計畫計畫的公務員培訓是對黑山數位轉型策略行動計畫活動的補充，旨在提高敏感公民群體（老年人、殘疾人、再生能源人口、等）在終身學習的過程中。透過實施這項措施，有助於實現永續發展目標，特別是目標10（減少國家之間和國家內部的不平等）和相關任務10.2（加強和促進每個人的社會、經濟和政治包容性，無論年齡、性別、殘疾、種族、族裔、出身、宗教或經濟或其他狀況），以及目標 16（和平、正義和強有力的機構），特別是任務 16.7。 - 確保負責任、包容、參與和代表性的決策； 16.10。 - 根據國家立法和國際協議，確保公眾獲取資訊並保護基本自由。 

預算 14.000 歐元

活動

Commitment Title: Improve the transparency of local parliaments
Full Text:
What public problem does the measure address? This measure responds to the problem of still inconsistent application of standards of transparency and openness in the work of local parliaments/municipal assemblies/local self-government units. There is not yet an up-to-date overview of the current state of transparency of the work of local parliaments, and it needs to be prepared as a basis for developing guidelines for improvement in that area. 

What does this measure entail? The measure includes activities intended to ensure that the public can more easily follow the sessions of the assemblies of all local self-governments. 

In what way does the measure contribute to the solution of the identified public problem? As support for the implementation of this activity, the Committee for the Development of Local Self- Government of the Community of Municipalities will review the current state of transparency of the work of local parliaments and develop Guidelines for their improvement. 

Why is this measure relevant in relation to the values promoted through the OGP initiative? This measure is directly relevant to the values of transparency and openness of local self-government, as a prerequisite for the active participation of citizens in local decision-making Additional information This measure is complementary to the goals and activities of the Public Administration Reform Strategy 2022-2026, especially in relation to strengthening the transparency and openness of local self- governments. In addition, the implementation of this measure contributes to the realization of sustainable development goals, especially goal 16: 'Peace, justice and strong institutions', and tasks 16.10. Provide public access to information and protection of basic freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements, 16.6 - Develop efficient, responsible and transparent institutions at all levels. 

Budget 22.000 EUR

Activities 

15.1. Create an analysis and overview of the current state of transparency in the work of local parliaments and prepare Guidelines for their improvement Holder: Ministry of Public Administration, Community of Municipalities (Committee for Local Self-Government System ZO) Indicators of activity realization: - prepared an analysis and overview of the current state of transparency in the work of local parliaments - Prepared Guidelines for their improvement Required financial resources: EUR 5,000 Source of funding: Budget of Montenegro, donor funds May 2023 - December 2023 

15.2. Create an assessment of the necessary technical prerequisites and financial resources for the introduction of public sessions of local parliaments (via YouTube channels or local public broadcasters) Holders: Ministry of Public AdministrationMinistry of Public Administration, local self-government units, Community municipality Activity realization indicator: - made an assessment Required financial resources: EUR 2,000 Source of funding: Budget of Montenegro, donor funds January 2024 - April 2024 

15.3. Publish a public invitation to interested municipalities to participate in the pilot program to support the openness of local parliaments Holder: Ministry of Public Administration Ministry of Public Administration Activity realization indicator: - prepared support program in cooperation with donors - published invitation with criteria for participation - selected at least three municipalities participating in the pilot program Required financial resources: EUR 15,000 Source of funding: Budget of Montenegro, donor funds May 2024 - December 2024
column17: ME0077 地方議會的透明度 Transparency of Local Parliaments
Full Text 中文:
該措施解決了什麼公共問題？這項措施解決了地方議會/市議會/地方自治單位工作中透明度和公開標準仍然不一致的問題。目前還沒有對地方議會工作透明度現狀的最新概述，需要將其作為制定該領域改進指導方針的基礎。 

這項措施意味著什麼？該措施包括旨在確保公眾能夠更輕鬆地關注所有地方自治政府議會會議的活動。 

該措施如何有助於解決已確定的公共問題？作為對這項活動實施的支持，市社區地方自治發展委員會將審查地方議會工作透明度的現狀，並制定改進指南。 

為什麼這項措施與 OGP 倡議所倡導的價值觀相關？該措施與地方自治政府的透明度和開放性價值觀直接相關，是公民積極參與地方決策的先決條件。在加強地方自治政府的透明度和開放性方面。此外，該措施的實施有助於實現永續發展目標，特別是目標16：「和平、正義和強有力的機構」和任務16.10。根據國家立法和國際協議，為公眾提供獲取資訊的機會並保護基本自由， 16.6 - 在各級建立高效、負責和透明的機構。 

預算 22.000 歐元

活動 

15.1.對地方議會工作的透明度現狀進行分析和概述，並製定改進指南 持有者：公共管理部、市政社區（地方自治系統 ZO 委員會） 活動實現指標： - 已準備對地方議會工作透明度現狀的分析和概述- 制定改善指南所需財政資源：5,000 歐元資金來源：黑山預算、捐款2023 年5 月- 2023 年12 月 

15.2.對引入地方議會公開會議（透過 YouTube 頻道或當地公共廣播公司）所需的技術先決條件和財政資源進行評估 持有者：公共管理部、地方自治單位、社區市政府 活動實現指標： - 進行了評估所需財政資源：2,000 歐元資金來源：黑山預算、捐款2024 年1 月- 2024 年4 月 

15.3。向有興趣的城市公開邀請參與試點計劃，以支持地方議會的開放性 持有者：公共管理部 公共管理部 活動實現指標： - 與捐助者合作制定支持計劃 - 發布包含參與標準的邀請 -選擇至少三個城市參與試點計畫所需財政資源：15,000 歐元資金來源：黑山預算、捐贈資金2024 年5 月- 2024 年12 月
Lead Institution: Ministry of Public Administration, Community of Municipalities
Supporting Institution(s): All local self-government units, donors, non-governmental organizations

Commitment Title: Implementing the provisions of Organic Law No. 130-13 on the finance law relating to budget transparency and performance-oriented budgeting
Full Text:
Implementing the provisions of Organic Law No. 130-13 on the finance law relating to budget transparency and performance-oriented budgeting
From June 2018 to March 2020
Lead implementing agency/actor
Directorate of Budget (Ministry of Economy and Finance)
Commitment description
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
The need to implement constitutional provisions that consecrate the right to information, preserve balanced public finances, promote good governance, and strengthen accountability to meet the expectations of citizens, who are increasingly aware of their rights within a modern, democratic state.
What is the commitment?
Increasing budget transparency while improving government performance and strengthening the role of Parliament on the budget debate and public finance scrutiny. 
How will the commitment contribute to solve the public problem?
Enriching budget information that are available to the Parliament and the public; ▪ Improving the budget’s legibility by passing towards a per-program presentation of public policy, with the consolidation of the regional dimension, ▪ Communicating the Finance Bill on a large-scale, ▪ Consecrating the principles of assessment and accountability; ▪ Strengthening fundamental budget principles (budget and accounting sincerity, and rationalising of the creation and use of Independently Managed Special Accounts of Treasury and State Agencies)
Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
The commitment is relevant because it makes budget information available to the public. The latter improves its quality and accessibility. The commitment is relevant in terms of public accountability, because each ministry prepares a Performance Report to support the budget review law for the year in question. 承諾說明
該承諾將解決哪些公共問題？
需要實施憲法條款，保障資訊權、維護平衡的公共財政、促進良好治理並加強問責制，以滿足公民的期望，因為公民在現代民主國家中越來越意識到自己的權利。
承諾是什麼？
提高預算透明度，同時提高政府績效並加強議會在預算辯論和公共財政審查中的作用。 
該承諾將如何有助於解決公共問題？
豐富議會和公眾可獲得的預算資訊； ▪ 透過對公共政策按計畫進行表述，並整合區域層面，提高預算的可讀性， ▪ 大規模傳達財政法案， ▪ 尊崇評估和問責原則； ▪ 加強基本預算原則（預算和會計誠實性，以及財政部和國家機構獨立管理特別帳戶的創建和使用的合理化）
為什麼這項承諾與 OGP 價值觀相關？
該承諾具有相關性，因為它向公眾提供了預算資訊。後者提高了其品質和可訪問性。這項承諾與公共問責制有關，因為每個部會準備一份績效報告來支持相關年份的預算審查法。本報告將所取得的成就與初步成果進行了比較

Commitment Title: Implementation of the legislative and constitutional provisions in terms of participatory and citizenbased democracy
Full Text:
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
 Implementation of the constitutional and legislative provisions in
terms of participatory and citizen-based democracy.
 Implementation by the House of Representatives of the
constitutional reforms in order to modernize its action and ensure a
better openness and communication with the citizens.
 The House of Representatives has devoted two chapters of its
bylaws to the pinpointing of the procedures of the practical
implementation of these rights.

What does the commitment consist of?
The commitment amounts to the implementation of a system of petitions and
motions within the House of Representatives.
A committee in charge of the reception and the management of the legislative
petitions and motions of citizens, is set up at the level of the bureau of the
House of Representatives. Within its annual action plan, it intends to
organize meetings/debates at the central and territorial levels with NGOs,
which do supervise the initiatives conducted by the citizens in the fields of
legislative petitions and motions, define the common frameworks of action
and elaborate the awareness raising tools (a practical guide) of the stake of
their actions and the procedures to follow.
What comes at stake at this stage, as well, is the development of the IT
platform for the management of the motions and the petitions. Such an
infrastructure is supposed to guarantee more transparency and fluidity.

How shall the commitment contribute to solving the public problem?
The House of Representatives, by virtue of its stand as a depository of the
legislative authority has fully assumed its role concerning the
implementation of the political and legal framework for the
implementation of such provisions : Two organic laws , which are
respectively related to the terms of the exercise of the right to present
petitions before the public authorities, as well as the conditions of the 
exercise of the right to put forward legislative petitions, have entered into
force since 2016.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
Such a new form of democratic exercise which allows citizens, among
others, to present to the public authorities, and to the elected institutions,
legislative petitions and motions, is, doubtlessly, a precondition for the
consolidation and the strengthening of the representative democracy.
It should ensure the accession of the citizens and their implication in
the decision making and legislative process.

 眾議院在其議案中特別用了兩個章節

Commitment Title: Engagement of citizens in the legislative process
Short Title: Allow Citizens to Comment on Draft Legislation
Short Title 中文: 允許公民對立法草案發表評論
Full Text:
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
Listening to citizens, taking into consideration their proposals, their ideas,
their remarks on the draft laws and proposals.

What does the commitment consist of?
Publish bills which are subject to the legislative procedures to allow citizens
to comment on them. The objective being to ensure the participation as well
as the engagement of citizens in the legislative processes.

How shall the commitment contribute to solving the public problem?
This is an initiative which is meant to enrich and improve the quality of
legislation, while partly guaranteeing the adherence and engagement of the
citizen in the building process of the Rule of Law. An institution which
respects the citizens and can only be respected and respectable.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
The accession and the engagement of the citizens in the decision making
and legislative process.
column17: MO0020 允許公民對立法草案發表評論 Allow Citizens to Comment on Draft Legislation

公民的加入與參與決策

Commitment Title: Implementation of the constitutional and legislative provisions regarding the right to access information
Short Title: Proactively Publication of Legislative Data and Documents
Short Title 中文: 積極發布立法數據和文件
Full Text:
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
This is about strengthening access to information detained by the public
administration, by the elected institutions as well as the organizations with
public service missions, given that this is a fundamental human right which
is guaranteed by the Moroccan Constitution. Right now, there aren’t any
regulatory provisions as per defining which information are to be
published.
The House of Representatives publishes the following information on the
web site:
http://www.chambredesrepresentants.ma/fr/annuaire-parlementaire.
It is worth noting that the majority of these data are not complete.
Consequently, the civil society organizations do encounter some difficulties
when it comes to finding out such information.

What does the commitment consist of?
Voluntarist dissemination and publication of information, data and
documents produced by the House of representatives, namely debates
which take place in plenary sessions as well throughout the committees’
meetings, the reports of the parliamentary fact finding committees, the
reports of the information missions, the reports of the thematic groups and
the reports of the public policy evaluation.
Given that by virtue of the law, a national committee is set up to the head of
Government’s office, and taking into consideration the separation of
powers’ principle, a committee in charge of the implementation of the
constitutional and legislative provisions regarding the right to access
information, shall be set up to report to the Speaker of the House of
Representatives.
In a similar vein, it makes a triumphant statement about opening the archive
of the House of Representatives to the public use, and to place the digital
documents on line (more than a million six hundred thousand documents
in open data) ; documents related to the determining moments of the
national political and parliamentary life, have been published in the past,
but aren’t any more accessible nowadays since the House of Representatives
is the unique custodian of the document library.

How shall the commitment contribute to solving the public problem?
This pertains to opening, to the public, many important chapters of the
political history of the country.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
Respecting and making this universal right respected, should guarantee
equality to all in terms of having access to information. It is considered as
an indispensable condition for transparency and good governance.

Additional Information 
Respecting and making respected the constitutional right of access to
information
column17: MO0021 積極發布立法數據和文件 Proactively Publication of Legislative Data and Documents
Full Text 中文:
該承諾將解決哪些公共問題？
這是為了加強公眾獲取資訊的管道
行政管理，由選舉產生的機構以及具有以下性質的組織負責
公共服務任務，因為這是一項基本人權
受到摩洛哥憲法的保障。目前，還沒有任何
監管規定，定義哪些資訊將被
發表。
眾議院發布以下訊息
網站：
http://www.chambredesrepresentants.ma/fr/annuaire-parlementaire。
值得注意的是，這些數據大部分並不完整。
因此，民間組織確實遇到了一些困難
當涉及到尋找此類資訊時。

承諾的內容包括什麼？
自願傳播和出版資訊、數據和
眾議院產生的文件，即辯論
這些活動在全體會議以及委員會的整個會議期間進行
會議、議會實況調查委員會的報告、
資訊訪問團的報告、專題小組的報告和
公共政策評估報告。
鑑於根據該法，設立了一個由主席擔任的國家委員會
政府辦公室，並考慮到與政府辦公室的分離
權力原則，負責執行的委員會
關於獲取權的憲法和立法規定
訊息，應設立以向眾議院議長報告
代表。
同樣，它對打開檔案做出了勝利的聲明
眾議院的權力向公眾開放，並將數位化
線上文件（超過一百六十萬文檔
在公開數據中）；與決定時刻相關的文件
國家政治和議會生活，過去已出版，
但自從眾議院以來，現在已經不再容易接近了
是文檔庫的唯一保管人。

該承諾將如何有助於解決公共問題？
這涉及到向公眾開放《公約》的許多重要章節。
該國的政治史。

為什麼這項承諾與 OGP 價值觀相關？
尊重這項普遍權利並使之受到尊重，應該保證
在獲取資訊方面人人平等。它被認為是
透明度和善政不可或缺的條件。

附加資訊 
尊重並尊重憲法賦予的獲取資訊的權利
資訊
Lead Institution: House of Representatives
Supporting Institution(s): The national commission on the right to information access, Transparency Morocco, The European Union

Commitment Title: Opening onto the public, namely onto the youth in order to make parliamentary endeavors better known
Short Title: Increase Opportunities for Citizens to Visit the Legislature
Short Title 中文: 增加公民參觀立法機關的機會
Full Text:
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
Citizens do not trust public institutions, including the parliament. They do
have the feeling that the laws as they are voted today by the parliament do
not express the real general will of the people. Citizens do have the
impression that their representatives do not care about what they think, and
that they do not represent them properly. Besides, the amalgam created by
the social media and the media in general contribute to the youth’s
displeasure and poor opinion about the parliament and the elected officials.
Implementation of an ambitious and broadly rich communication plan which
targets the youth in particular, via a physical openness approach while
upholding relevant and appropriate content and discourse as disseminated
by various means of communication.
Integrating with success the increasing number of youth in the democratic
process that Morocco has embarked on poses many challenges, but equally
represents great opportunities.
Up to date, however, many young people find out themselves on the
margins of the political process, as they are very often called upon to
reclaim social and political change.
In order to become truly inclusive and representative, parliaments should
spare no effort in order to open their institution, so that the ideas and needs
of the youth be harnessed in a democratic manner.
 Increase the number of visitors of the House of Representatives, by
reinforcing the staff capacity in the organization and facilitated access
of visitors, through setting up units of public relations in order to
oversee and facilitate the access of the public to the headquarters of the
parliament.
 Increase substantially the number of groups’ facilitated visits, namely
groups of pupils from both the primary, junior and high schools as well 
as students from colleges and universities beyond the close
neighborhood of the capital Rabat.
 Create a space for the historical memory of the parliament of Morocco,
which reminds the young generations of the parliamentary group as
imbricated in its national context.
 Diversify the dissemination of contents that are meant to bring the
public closer to the parliament’s life, parliament’s debates, new
legislation, parliament’s initiatives, through the publications, the
Parliament’s channel, as well as the social media of the House of
Representatives.
 Elaborate communication toolkits (the booklets) designed for the
children and for the youth and organize meetings/debates at the
regional level (within the framework of the mobile parliament).

How shall the commitment contribute to solving the public problem?
Encourage the citizen participation among the future generations and foster
citizen participation among future generations while countering the general
anti-parliamentarianism trend.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
Encourage participation, as well as awareness of the stakes related to voting
and to democracy, and by the same token foster the citizen-based control
and oversight over public action.
column17: MO0022 增加公民參觀立法機關的機會 Increase Opportunities for Citizens to Visit the Legislature
Full Text 中文:
該承諾將解決哪些公共問題？
公民不信任包括議會在內的公共機構。他們是這樣

他們的代表不關心他們的想法，並且

社群媒體和一般媒體有助於青年人
對議會和民選官員的不滿和不良看法。
實施雄心勃勃且內容廣泛的溝通計劃，
透過身體開放的方式，特別針對年輕人，同時
維護所傳播的相關且適當的內容和話語
透過各種通訊方式。
成功地將越來越多的青年融入民主社會

然而，時至今日，許多年輕人發現自己

該承諾將如何有助於解決公共問題？
鼓勵子孫後代的公民參與並培養

為什麼這項承諾與 OGP 價值觀相關？
鼓勵參與以及對與投票相關的利害關係的認識

Commitment Title: Consultation and engagement of citizens in the processes of evaluation of public policies
Full Text:
What is the public
problem that the
commitment will
address?
The Consultation and the engagement of citizens in the processes of public
policies ‘evaluation
What does the
commitment consist of ?
-Spur parliamentary groups and members of the parliament to propose topics
of programmes and public policies‘ evaluations, the latter target a population
which can be identified, and, therefore, consulted with by the taskforce in
charge of conducting the evaluation, both upstream as well as downstream, in
accordance with the referential framework set up for the evaluation of public policies.
- Spur the steering committee of the taskforce in charge of conducting the
evaluation decided by the bureau of the House of Representatives to opt for
evaluation criteria while taking into consideration the degree of impact of the
public policies on citizens’ lives.
These two criteria, which require field research, are up to making every
evaluation initiative an opportunity to communicate and allow for the
participation of a maximum number of beneficiaries and of the counterfactual
population of the programme, which is, indeed, the subject of the evaluation.
Such an association can be inscribed within the phase of the evaluation
preparation and that of the formulation of the conclusions together with the
recommendations.
-Invite the group in charge of the evaluation to ensure a good communication
with the ultimate target groups and beneficiaries in order to better define both
their needs and aspirations.
A synthesis of this communication shall be attached to the evaluation report. 
Page | 79
To guarantee a better profitability of the evaluation project, a large
dissemination of the evaluation reports is a must. The follow up by the
political authorities of the House of Representatives is fundamental for the
improvement and the productivity of the public policies.
In terms of accountability, the conclusions of the evaluation reports can serve
as a basis for the evaluation of public interventions and their impact on the
population.
How shall the
commitment contribute
to solving the public
problem?
The House of Representatives has put into place a referential framework for
the evaluation of public policies, which acts as a guiding tool when it comes
to the management of the evaluation activities. While indicating the
procedure to follow throughout the whole process, from the very selection of
the topic to the elaboration of the final report. This guide, as well as, the bylaws of the House of Representatives, do give a prominent position to the
research techniques that spur the contribution of the stakeholders of the policy
or of the programme, which is subject to evaluation, namely the public
authorities all along with the entities in charge of the implementation of the
concerned public policies, and most particularly, the ultimate target groups
and beneficiaries.
Why is this commitment
relevant to OGP values?
The evaluation of the public policies is one of the new prerogatives of the
parliament of Morocco, which has been upgraded and fostered to the position
of parliamentary function, as stipulated by the new 2011 Constitution. The
House of Representatives has, from the very beginning, set its sight on the
serious and certain launch of this new function. First of all, through avoiding
the conceptual confusions with the related streams of work of the Parliament,
and secondly through ensuring its institutionalization which clearly
distinguishes the political from the scientific, in its practical exercise and in
terms of the credibility of these end products.

Commitment Title: Establishment of a partnership with civil society and academia
Short Title: Establishment of a Partnership with Civil Society and Academia
Short Title 中文: 與民間社會和學術界建立夥伴關係
Full Text:
What is the public problem that the commitment will address?
There is necessity for strengthening and developing a partnership with both
civil society and academia.

What does the commitment consist of ?
-Organize central and territorial meetings/debates with the NGOs.
-Provide for an organized openness onto academia and encourage research
and studies on democracy and parliamentarianism through the organization
of study days and conferences on Parliament within the universities.
The organized meetings will allow for the development of democratic
practices, encourage participation on various topics and themes related to
issues such as the protection of the environment, ICT, civic values, human
rights and education. The latter are privileged themes of such debates.

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values?
The engagement of civil society, of the university and that of organizations
acting like think –tanks, is a key factor for achieving a democracy of quality.
column17: MO0024 與民間社會和學術界建立夥伴關係 Establishment of a Partnership with Civil Society and Academia
