column17: CZ0031 通過並促進舉報人保護立法 Adopt and promote whistleblower protection legislation
Full Text 中文:
該承諾將解決哪些公共問題？社會對舉報人有一種扭曲（負面）的看法，這並不能反映他們對偵查非法行為和防止其他非法情況的真正貢獻。舉報人常常遭到社會的報復和譴責。這種情況導致潛在舉報人為了公共利益舉報違法行為的動機減弱。 

承諾是什麼？該承諾包括立法、教育和媒體活動，旨在提高舉報人的社會認知。 

該承諾將如何有助於解決公共問題？ 《保護舉報人法》的通過將實施歐洲議會和理事會 2019 年 10 月 23 日關於保護舉報違反歐盟法律的人員的指令 (EU) 2019/1937。該法案還提議成立舉報人保護機構，該機構除其他外將負責收集和發布舉報數據，提供該領域的專家建議並提高公眾對該問題的認識。該法案的通過將伴隨著一場媒體宣傳活動，旨在糾正舉報的概念，並明確舉報人保護法適用的犯罪範圍。題為「透過提高公共部門的意識，重點關注法官、執法機構和公共行政部門，加強反腐敗鬥爭」的項目是善政計劃的一部分，將解決舉報人保護問題：a) 媒體宣傳活動，包括編寫小冊子，b) 國際專家會議，c) 進行比較研究，分享國外的良好做法，d) 對舉報人舉報案件的報告進行統計監測，以及e) 培訓專家（檢察官、法官）。 

為什麼這項承諾與 OGP 價值觀相關？透明度：由於捷克社會對舉報問題的認識不斷提高，從而提高了潛在舉報人的積極性（或減少了他們的猶豫），這應該會導致加大對非法活動（包括腐敗）的打擊力度，社會將獲悉有關情況第12 頁（共24 頁） ）透過媒體和網站 korupce.cz。公民參與：舉報人主動性的提高旨在提高公民對公共事務的參與水平，這是《舉報人保護法》通過的結果，也是提高社會問題意識的結果。舉報人將更有動力發現雇主的不當行為，如果滿足法律規定的條件，舉報人將有權發布有關違規行為的資訊。公共責任：提高舉報意識的目的之一是打擊公務員的侵權行為，並引入公職人員的「控制制度」。因此，對整個社會產生負面影響的腐敗行為應該更容易被發現和起訴。 

其他資訊 - 舉報人保護目標是 2018 年至 2022 年政府反腐敗構想的一部分。就與其他永續發展目標的重疊而言，舉報人保護是關鍵領域之一，類似於環境保護。因此，加強對此領域侵權行為的偵查是舉報人保護議程的目標之一。 - 制定全面有效的舉報法規也符合民主人權辦公室或經合組織賄賂問題工作小組的建議。 

具有可驗證成果的里程碑活動 開始日期： 結束日期： 透過舉報人保護法 2021.12.17 支持透過舉報人保護法的媒體宣傳活動 2020.1.11 2022.3.31實施「透過提高公共部門認識加強反腐敗鬥爭，重點關注30. 4. 2023 第13 頁（共24 頁）法官、執法機構和公共行政部門”
Lead Institution: Ministry of Justice (OSZBK)
Supporting Institution(s): State actors involved CSOs, private sector, multilaterals, working groups Working Commission for Whistleblowing

Commitment Title: Improving the status of whistleblowers, including raising awareness of whistleblowing
Full Text:
Brief Description of the Commitment 

The commitment consists in legislative, educational, and awareness-raising activities, the aim of which is to improve the legal and social status of whistleblowers, including increasing public awareness of whistleblowing as such.

Problem Definition 

1. What problem does the commitment aim to address? The Czech Republic does not yet have a comprehensive legal framework for whistleblowing. Potential whistleblowers (persons who report their knowledge on any wrongdoing) are currently not sufficiently protected against the retaliatory measures that often fall upon them after they reported the wrongdoing. At the same time, confidential and trustworthy reporting channels for whistleblowing are not set up by law, except for service authorities. There is also a distorted (negative) perception of whistleblowers in society that does not reflect their personal courage and real contribution to the detection of unlawful behaviour and the prevention or correction of infringements. On the contrary, whistleblowers are often subject to social condemnation and misunderstanding. This situation results in a reduced incentive for potential whistleblowers to report wrongdoing, the suppression of which is in the public interest. At the same time, the early detection of criminal or other unlawful activities based on the submitted reports is one of the necessary elements, which can bring about savings of public funds, averting a common threat or protecting people's lives and health.

2. What are the causes of the problem? The reasons for the above stigmatisation of whistleblowers can be seen both in the lack of legislation and in the societal attitude towards whistleblowers. The absence of legally enshrined secure reporting channels guaranteeing potential whistleblowers the protection of their identity, apart from Act No. 234/2014 Coll., on the Civil Service, and the relevant implementing provisions, is only one of the problems. Whistleblowers are not protected from retaliation, namely from employers, which may have a major impact on their professional and personal lives. Insufficient legal protection also sends a signal to society that the protection of whistleblowers is not a priority, which is further worsening their position. The negative perception of whistleblowers by a significant part of society is the result of a combination of factors. The historical experience in the Czech Republic with informers during totalitarian regimes during the 20th century is obvious. The change in public perception of whistleblowers has been very slow since 1989. This is, among other things, due to a lack of awareness, which is largely addressed only by the non-profit sector. 

Commitment Description 

1. What has been done so far to solve the problem? There is no specific provision for the protection of whistleblowers enshrined in Czech legislation, except for the protection of whistleblowers from the ranks of civil servants according to Government Regulation No. 145/2015 Coll., on Measures Related to the Reporting of Suspected Infringements in a Public Offce. Whistleblowers are protected in criminal matters by general institutes of legal regulations against unlawful retaliation by the persons against whom the report was directed or by other persons who suffered damage as a result of the report. A whistleblower is protected from certain retaliatory measures within the framework of the employment or service relationship, namely by the contents of the regulations governing the relevant legal relationship. All these legal regulations contain legislation in the field of employment or service relationship that significantly limits the discretion of the employer and protects the employee. However, the measures mentioned above do not provide whistleblowers with sufficiently credible, confidential, and accessible channels through which the report can be made to the employer or an external authority, nor do they provide specialised advisory or legal support that a whistleblower often needs prior to submitting a report. As part of the fulfilment of the previous commitment enshrined in the Fifth Action Plan, the draft law on the protection of whistleblowers and the related amending law, aimed at implementing Directive (EU) 2019/1937 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2019 on the protection of persons who report breaches of Union law (the "Directive"), was prepared by the Ministry of Justice, approved by the Government and debated at first reading by the Chamber of Deputies of the Parliament of the Czech Republic. However, with the end of the parliamentary term, the debate on the draft laws was not completed and the draft laws will have to go through the legislative process again. As of 17 December 2021, the Ministry of Justice, in relation to the direct vertical effect of the Directive not yet transposed, established an external reporting channel and a website containing relevant information on whistleblower protection under the Directive at its request at the address oznamovatel.justice.cz. The Ministry of Justice is also carrying out intensive methodological work, producing background material and actively communicating with entities at both the state and local level in relation to their obligation under the Directive to implement an internal reporting system. At the time the Sixth Action Plan was being drawn up and discussed, the interdepartmental comment procedure was conducting on the draft laws re-submitted by the Ministry of Justice and only partially modified, and afterwards, the settlement of the submitted comments. In cooperation with a media expert consultant, documents were also prepared for the tender documentation for the public procurement relating to ensure a media campaign and the necessary public contracts were administered under the project "Intensification of the fight against corruption by raising awareness of the public sector with a focus on judges, law enforcement authorities, and public administration". Details of the fulfilment of the previous commitment of the Fifth Action Plan have been published quarterly on the Commitment Card at https://korupce.cz/partnerstvi-pro- otevrene-vladnuti-ogp/narodni-akcni-plany-nap/paty-akcni-plan-2020-2022/faze- implementace/zavazek-4-2-zvyseni-povedomi-o-problematice-oznamovatelu-protipravniho- jednani/. 

2. What solution do you propose? The adoption of the Act on the Protection of Whistleblowers will, in addition to the implementation of the Directive, lead to the adoption of the first comprehensive legal regulation of the rules for reporting, the protection of whistleblowers, and the obligations of entities in the public and private sectors in the Czech Republic. The fact that the legislation on the protection of whistleblowers is based on the Directive will then send a clear signal to society that whistleblower protection is a priority at European Union level as well. The adoption of whistleblower protection rules emphasises their societal importance and, conversely, affects behaviour which is prejudicial to them as a result of reporting. In relation to awareness-raising, the draft law under consideration sets assignments, inter alia, for the Ministry of Justice to collect and publish data on whistleblowing issues or to provide expert advice in this area. The Ministry of Justice will also continuously raise awareness of the status and social contribution of whistleblowers as part of its work. The discussion and adoption of the proposed legislation will be synergistically accompanied by the implementation of the project "Intensifying the fight against corruption by raising public sector awareness with focus on judges, law enforcement agencies and public administration", which is part of the Good Governance Programme. The project includes the following range ofactivities of an educational and informative nature aimed mainly at improving the social perception of whistleblowers: a) creation of a comparative study to share good practice abroad, publication of this study on the website korupce.cz, b) media campaign aimed at promoting whistleblowing, c) international conference on whistleblower protection, d) a series of workshops and trainings for justice and public administration workers focused on the issue of whistleblowing and protection of whistleblowers, creation of an e-learning course, e) ongoing publicity includes, among other things, informing about partial outputs of the project in the form of press releases and publication on the website of the Ministry of Justice (justice.cz, korupce.cz), f) statistical monitoring of reporting cases raised by whistleblowers, publication of statistics. 

3. What results do we want to achieve by implementing this commitment? As a result of the introduction of comprehensive legislative protection for whistleblowers and the establishment of reporting channels, an increase in the number of credible reports of criminal offences or other unlawful activity is expected. This should result in a reduction of proceeds from corruption or other illegal activities that have been detected as a result of whistleblowing. The adoption of comprehensive legislation will then lead to an improvement in the status of whistleblowers in judicial or administrative proceedings, but also an improvement in the status of ex ante whistleblowers. An essential part of the Ministry of Justice's activities will be the raising awareness of society on the topic of whistleblowing, which, together with the adoption of the draft law and the Directive itself, represents a fundamental step towards improving the perception of whistleblowers in the Czech society. A change in the perception of whistleblowers as denunciators by the public, but also by potential whistleblowers themselves, is crucial to the success of the proposed regulation. In this sense, the Ministry of Justice will provide whistleblowers with comprehensible information regarding the reporting procedure itself, present model situations, familiarize whistleblowers with information on protecting their identity and, last but not least, clearly inform the public about what retaliation measures are and how to defend against them and point out their undesirable nature. 

Analysis of the commitment 

1. How will the commitment promote transparency? Entities in both the public and private sectors will be required to inform potential whistleblowers about the possibility to raise a report and about the rules for protection against retaliation. In addition, the Ministry of Justice will also be required to publish information on combating unlawful activities (on the website korupce.cz) and provide methodical and professional assistance in the whistleblower protection agenda.

2. How will the commitment help foster accountability? Improving awareness of whistleblowing aims, inter alia, to increase the level of combating unlawful behaviour by public officials, to strengthen public control, including internal (in-house) preventive and control mechanisms. Corruption practices with a negative impact on society as a whole should thus be more easily detected and prosecuted. 

3. How will this commitment improve citizens' participation in the development, implementation, and monitoring of solutions adopted? Increasing the initiative of whistleblowers through the adoption of the Whistleblower Protection Act and improving public awareness of their status and usefulness aims to increase the level of civic participation in public affairs. Whistleblowers will be more motivated to detect wrongdoings of their employers and will be entitled to publish information about the infringement if the conditions set by law are met. 

Commitment Planning (Milestones | Foreseen outputs | Estimated date of completion)

The adoption of the law on the protection of whistleblowers | Act on the Protection of Whistleblowers promulgated in the Collection of Laws and effective | 1 July 2023

Implementation of the project "Intensifying the fight against corruption by raising public sector awareness with focus on judges, law enforcement agencies and public administration" | a) creation of a comparative study to share good practice abroad, publication of this study on the website korupce.cz, b) media campaign aimed at promoting whistleblowing, c) international conference on whistleblower protection, d) series of workshops and trainings for judiciary and public administration staff focused on the issue of whistleblowing and protection of whistleblowers, creation of an e-learning course, e) ongoing publicity includes, among other things, informing about partial outputs of the project in the form of press releases and publication on the website of the Ministry of Justice (justice.cz, korupce.cz), f) statistical monitoring of reporting cases raised by whistleblowers, publication of statistics. | 31 December 2023
column17: CZ0036 透過舉報人保護立法 Adopt Legislation on Whistleblower Protections
Full Text 中文:
承諾簡介 

該承諾包括立法、教育和提高意識活動，其目的是提高舉報人的法律和社會地位，包括提高公眾對舉報本身的認識。

問題定義 

1. 該承諾旨在解決什麼問題？捷克共和國尚未制定全面的舉報法律架構。潛在的舉報人（報告自己了解任何不法行為的人）目前沒有得到充分的保護，以防止他們在舉報不法行為後經常遭受的報復性措施。同時，除服務機構外，法律並未設立保密且值得信賴的舉報管道。社會上還存在對舉報人的扭曲（負面）看法，這並不能反映他們的個人勇氣和對偵查非法行為以及預防或糾正侵權行為的真正貢獻。相反，舉報人往往會受到社會的譴責和誤解。這種情況導致潛在舉報人舉報不當行為的動機降低，而製止不當行為符合公共利益。同時，根據提交的報告及早發現犯罪或其他非法活動是必要的要素之一，可以節省公共資金，避免共同威脅或保護人民的生命和健康。

2. 問題產生的原因是什麼？造成上述檢舉人污名化的原因既有立法的缺失，也有社會對檢舉人的態度。除了關於公務員制度的第 234/2014 Coll. 號法案及相關實施規定外，缺乏法律規定的安全舉報管道來保障潛在舉報人的身份，這只是問題之一。舉報人無法免受報復，即來自雇主的報復，這可能對其職業和個人生活產生重大影響。法律保護不足也向社會發出了一個信號：對舉報人的保護不是優先事項，這進一步惡化了舉報人的處境。社會很大一部分人對舉報人的負面看法是多種因素共同作用的結果。捷克共和國20世紀極權政權時期告密者的歷史經驗是顯而易見的。自 1989 年以來，公眾對舉報人看法的變化非常緩慢。 

承諾說明 

1. 到目前為止，我們採取了哪些措施來解決這個問題？捷克立法中沒有關於保護舉報人的具體規定，但根據關於報告涉嫌侵權行為的相關措施的第 145/2015 Coll. 號政府條例，對公務員隊伍中的舉報人進行了保護。舉報人在刑事案件中受到一般法律法規機構的保護，免受舉報對像或因舉報而遭受損害的其他人的非法報復。舉報人在僱用或服務關係的框架內，即受到管轄相關法律關係的法規的內容的保護，免受某些報復措施的影響。所有這些法律法規都包含僱傭或服務關係領域的立法，極大地限制了雇主的自由裁量權並保護僱員。然而，上述措施並沒有為舉報人提供足夠可信、保密和方便的向雇主或外部機構舉報的管道，也沒有提供舉報人在舉報之前經常需要的專業諮詢或法律支持。作為履行第五個行動計畫中先前承諾的一部分，保護舉報人法草案及相關修訂法旨在執行歐洲議會和 23 國理事會指令 (EU) 2019/1937 2019 年10 月，關於保護舉報違反聯盟法行為的人員（「指示」），由司法部編寫，經政府批准，並由捷克共和國議會眾議院一讀進行辯論。不過，隨著議會任期的結束，法律草案的辯論尚未完成，法律草案將不得不再次進入立法程序。截至 2021 年 12 月 17 日，司法部針對尚未轉換的指令的直接縱向影響，建立了一個外部報告渠道和一個網站，其中包含根據指令提供的舉報人保護相關信息，地址為 oznamovatel。司法部也正在進行深入的方法工作，製作背景資料，並就指令規定的實施內部報告製度的義務與國家和地方各級實體積極溝通。在製定和討論第六個行動計劃時，司法部重新提交的法律草案正在進行部門間徵求意見程序，僅進行了部分修改，隨後對提交的意見進行了解決。也與媒體專家顧問合作，編寫了公共採購招標文件，以確保在「透過提高公共部門的認識加強反腐敗鬥爭」項目下進行媒體宣傳和管理必要的公共合約重點關注法官、執法當局和公共行政部門」。第五行動計畫先前承諾的履行細節已每季在承諾卡上公佈：https://korupce.cz/partnerstvi-pro-otevrene-vladnuti-ogp/narodni-akcni-plany-nap/paty- akcni-plan- 2020-2022/faze-implementace/zavazek-4-2-zvyseni-povedomi-o-problematice-oznamovatelu-protipravniho-jednani/。 

2. 您提出什麼解決方案？ 《舉報人保護法》的通過除了實施該指令外，還將導致通過第一個關於報告規則、舉報人保護以及公共實體義務的全面法律法規和捷克共和國的私營部門。事實上，基於該指令的舉報人保護立法將向社會發出明確的信號，即舉報人保護也是歐盟層面的優先事項。舉報人保護規則的採用強調了舉報人的社會重要性，相反，影響了因舉報而對其不利的行為。在提高意識方面，正在審議的法律草案規定了司法部收集和發布舉報問題數據或提供該領域專家建議等任務。司法部也將不斷提高對舉報人地位和社會貢獻的認識，作為工作的一部分。擬議立法的討論和通過將與「透過提高公共部門意識，重點關注法官、執法機構和公共行政部門加強反腐敗鬥爭」計畫的實施相結合，該計畫是善治計畫的一部分。該計畫包括以下一系列教育性和資訊性活動，主要旨在提高舉報人的社會認知：a) 進行比較研究以分享國外的良好做法，在 korupce.cz 網站上發布本研究，b) 媒體旨在促進舉報的運動，c) 舉報人保護國際會議，d) 為司法和公共行政工作人員舉辦一系列講習班和培訓，重點關注舉報和保護舉報人問題，開設電子學習課程，e) 正在進行除其他外，宣傳包括以新聞稿和在司法部網站（justice.cz、korupce.cz）上發布的形式通報該項目的部分成果，f) 對舉報人舉報案件的統計監測，公佈統計數據。 

3. 透過履行這項承諾，我們希望能取得哪些成果？由於對舉報人實施全面的立法保護並建立舉報管道，預計刑事犯罪或其他非法活動的可信舉報數量將會增加。這應該會減少因舉報而被發現的腐敗或其他非法活動的利益。全面立法的通過將改善司法或行政訴訟中舉報人的地位，同時也改善事前舉報人的地位。司法部活動的一個重要組成部分是提高社會對舉報這一主題的認識，這與法律草案和指令本身的通過一起，代表著捷克朝著改善舉報人觀念邁出了根本性的一步。公眾以及潛在舉報人本身對舉報人作為舉報者的看法的改變對於擬議法規的成功至關重要。從這個意義上說，司法部將為舉報人提供有關舉報程序本身的全面信息，展示典型情況，讓舉報人熟悉保護其身份的信息，最後但並非最不重要的一點是，明確告知公眾報復措施是什麼以及如何打擊報復。 

承諾分析 

1. 該承諾將如何提高透明度？公共和私營部門的實體都必須告知潛在的舉報人提出報告的可能性以及防止報復的規則。此外，司法部也將被要求發布有關打擊非法活動的資訊（在korupce.cz網站上），並在舉報人保護議程中提供有條理和專業的協助。

2. 該承諾將如何幫助加強問責制？提高舉報意識，除其他外，旨在提高打擊公職人員違法行為的水平，加強公共控制，包括內部預防和控制機制。因此，對整個社會產生負面影響的腐敗行為應該更容易被發現和起訴。 

3. 這項承諾將如何提高公民對所採用解決方案的製定、實施和監督的參與？透過制定《舉報人保護法》，提高舉報人的積極性，提高公眾對其地位和角色的認識，旨在提高公民參與公共事務的水平。舉報人將更有動力發現雇主的不當行為，如果滿足法律規定的條件，將有權發布有關侵權的資訊。

Commitment Title: Transparency Register
Full Text:
There is a good legal foundation for openness in Finland. As the world changes, the legal foundation also requires supplementation. An international comparative study on lobby registers was carried out based on a commitment in the II Action Plan of open government. A parliamentary committee was established after the study and it issued an unanimous proposition recommending the establishment of the transparency register. 

The transparency register will offer citizens information on the parties that seek to influence decision-making. Decision-makers will be provided more in-depth information on the roles of the parties that seek to influence them. The register will help lobbyists to provide more information about their lobbying and influencing activities in an increasingly open manner.

Of the OGP initiatives, the transparency register corresponds particularly to that of transparency and accountability.

Establishment of transparency register
In accordance with the Government Programme, a law on the transparency register will be enacted after parliamentary preparation and consultation with civil society. The purpose of the act is to improve the transparency of decision-making and, through this, prevent inappropriate influences and strengthen public confidence.

In the preparation of the transparency register legislation, the basic rights and freedoms of natural persons will be taken into account and special attention will be paid to the safety of their personal data.

It will be established whether it will be possible to include data on the outside employment and private interests of public officials. Government officials are required to submit notifications of their private interests and outside employment. If working hours are used for the tasks of the outside employment or if it can impact the impartiality of a government official, a permit to engage in outside employment will be required. The data submitted has not been recorded in a register. 

It will furthermore be explored whether it will be possible to collect records of the parties invited to parliamentary committee hearings in a single transparency register. It could also be possible to append a list of the post-employment waiting period agreements as referred to in the State Civil Servants Act.

It will also be established whether it will be possible to collect private interests data on a municipal level into a national transparency register.
column17: FI0032 政府決策登記冊 Register of Government Decision-Making
Full Text 中文:
芬蘭的開放有良好的法律基礎。隨著世界的變化，法律基礎也需要補充。根據第二個開放政府行動計畫中的承諾，進行了一項關於遊說登記冊的國際比較研究。研究後成立了議會委員會，並一致提出建議建立透明度登記冊。 

透明度登記冊將為公民提供有關尋求影響決策的各方的資訊。決策者將獲得有關試圖影響他們的各方角色的更深入資訊。這本登記冊將幫助遊說者以日益開放的方式提供更多有關其遊說和影響活動的資訊。

在 OGP 措施中，透明度登記冊特別對應於透明度和問責制。

建立透明度登記冊
根據政府計劃，在議會籌備並與民間社會協商後，將頒布一項關於透明度登記冊的法律。該法案的目的是提高決策的透明度，並透過此防止不當影響並增強公眾信心。

在製定透明度登記立法時，將考慮自然人的基本權利和自由，並特別關注其個人資料的安全。

將確定是否有可能納入有關公職人員的外部就業和私人利益的數據。政府官員必須提交其私人利益和外部就業的通知。如果工作時間用於外部就業任務或可能影響政府官員的公正性，則需要獲得外部就業許可證。提交的資料尚未記錄在登記冊中。 

此外，還將探討是否有可能在單一透明度登記冊中收集受邀參加議會委員會聽證會的各方的記錄。也可以附加《國家公務員法》中提到的離職後等待期協議清單。

也將確定是否有可能將市級私人利益數據收集到國家透明度登記冊中。
Lead Institution: Ministry of Justice
Supporting Institution(s): NA

Commitment Title: Open Regional and Local Authorities' Data
Short Title: Open Regional and Local Authorities' Data
Short Title 中文: 開放地區和地方當局的數據
Full Text:
STAKES 
 To meet the citizens’ legitimate expectations and considering the large proportion of public funds spent by local and regional authorities, the financial transparency of these local authorities must be improved.
 CONTEXT & AIM Numerous local and regional authorities have begun using digital tools to account for their financial management and to increase budgetary transparency. The Government wishes to support and encourage this movement, which will be enhanced by the bill on the new territorial organization of the Republic (NOTRe). It will provide the legislative framework necessary to pursue this openness and data circulation policy, particularly regarding financial data. Currently, all documents attached to the budgets and accounts of city governments, including documents substantiating the accounts, may be communicated to anyone requesting them, in application of article L. 2121-26 of the local and regional authorities' general code. The publication of budgets and financial statements in open data has already been implemented by various local authorities such as the city of Rennes, the city of Montpellier, the city of Paris, the province of Hauts-de-Seine, the Provence Alpes Côtes d'Azur region… Furthermore, the Public Finances Directorate-General already publishes local authority financial files summarizing the main financial and tax issues, making information easy to access. They can be found on the joint site DGCL-DGFiP: collectivités-locales.gouv.fr. Further progress is planned in this area. It is planned to soon publish this information in open data. Lastly, since 2014 the financial jurisdictions3 initiated the opening of the first sets of public data, and now wish to go further with this approach, particularly by publishing more financial data.
 
 ROADMAP 
 - Allow citizens to better grasp the financial details of local and regional authorities - Publish in open data the general operating grant (Dotation globale de fonctionnement) which is the State's financial contribution to local and regional authorities - Publish in open data, on data.gouv.fr, all of account balances of local authorities and groups with specific taxation, from 2013 financial year onward - Make it compulsory for local executives and chairmen of EPCI to present a report to deliberative assembly (municipal, departmental or regional council) on the follow-up given to observations made by the regional chamber of the Cour des comptes 
 - Regularly provide the financial data of the financial jurisdictions such as: - The data used for the work on local finance - Some data on financial jurisdictions activities, notably the updated list of publications from the Cour des comptes and the resources of the financial jurisdictions
 - Strengthen open data in local and regional authorities: enshrine in law the requirement for local communities of more than 3500 inhabitants to publish their public information in open data format
column17: FR0001 開放地區和地方當局的數據 Open Regional and Local Authorities' Data
Full Text 中文:
賭注 
 為了滿足公民的合理期望，考慮到地方和地區當局花費的公共資金比例很大，必須提高這些地方當局的財務透明度。
 背景和目標 許多地方和地區當局已開始使用數位工具來核算其財務管理並提高預算透明度。政府希望支持和​​鼓勵這項運動，關於共和國新領土組織（NOTRe）的法案將加強這項運動。它將提供推行這種開放和資料流通政策所必需的立法框架，特別是在金融資料方面。目前，根據地方和地區當局總法第 L. 2121-26 條，市政府預算和帳目所附的所有文件，包括證實帳目的文件，都可以傳達給任何提出要求的人。雷恩市、蒙彼利埃市、巴黎市、上塞納省、普羅旺斯阿爾卑斯山麓等多個地方當局已經實施了公開數據公佈預算和財務報表的做法蔚藍地區……此外，公共財政總局已經發布了地方當局的財務文件，總結了主要的財務和稅務問題，使資訊易於獲取。您可以在 DGCL-DGFiP 聯合網站上找到它們：collectivités-locales.gouv.fr。計劃在該領域取得進一步進展。計劃很快以開放資料的形式發布這些資訊。最後，自 2014 年以來，金融管轄區3開始開放第一組公共數據，現在希望進一步採用這種方法，特別是發布更多金融數據。
 
 路線圖 
 - 讓公民更好地掌握地方和地區當局的財務細節- 在開放數據中發布一般運營補助金(Dotation globale de fonctionnement)，這是國家對地方和地區當局的財政貢獻- 在data.gouv 上以開放資料形式發佈.fr，從 2013 財政年度起，地方當局和特定稅收團體的所有帳戶餘額 - 強制要求 EPCI 的地方行政人員和主席向審議大會（市、部門或地區委員會）提交以下報告- 高等法院地區分庭提出的意見 
 - 定期提供金融管轄區的財務數據，例如： - 用於地方金融工作的數據 - 有關金融管轄區活動的一些數據，特別是法國審計院的最新出版物清單和金融管轄區的資源
 - 加強地方和地區當局的開放資料：將要求超過 3500 名居民的當地社區以開放資料格式發佈公共資訊的要求寫入法律

Commitment Title: Further expand the Opening of Legal Resources & the Collaboration with Civil Society on Opening the Law
Full Text:
STAKES
 Understanding of law and access to justice are the pillars of the Rule of Law. In a digital era, this ambition is not restricted to diffusing content of the law but requires also accessibility to jurisprudence, the possibility for all citizens to develop innovative tools or services based on this content (thanks to its availability in open data), and the ability to stimulate and successfully mobilize citizens' expertise and contributions.
 
 CONTEXT & AIM
 France already has created in 2001 a major public service for the dissemination of law over the Internet. According to the terms of decree No. 2002-1064 dated on August 7th, 2002 amended, on the public service for the dissemination of law over the Internet, the site Légifrance is intended to facilitate public access to texts in force as well as to jurisprudence. It already provides free, universal access to all sources of law (legislative and regulatory texts, treaties, codes, jurisprudence of the Constitutional Council, the Council of State and the French Supreme Court, etc.). The open-data provision of legal data and data relating to a legal bill or its preparation allows citizens to better understand the entire legislative process, develop tools or applications from this data and participate actively in the democratic debate.
 The opening of legal data is thus at the core of governmental action, with the open-data publication of the databases of the Legal and Administrative Information Department (DILA) of the Prime Minister’s Office, and the establishment of the "Open Law" program. This program has given rise to numerous innovative applications developed by start-ups, researchers and companies, which were then rewarded. The publication in open data of the Official Bulletin of Public Contract Declarations (BOAMP), the Civil and Commercial Announcements Official Bulletin (BODACC) and the Mandatory Legal Notices Official Bulletin (BALO) will complement this approach. 20 Lastly, the consultation of citizens on government bills or before their preparation enables the construction of effective public decisions may revitalizes democracy. When preparing the Digital Bill, the French Digital Council coordinated an online consultation over six months (see details and data in the "methodology" appendix). It demonstrated the extent and ability of administrations and civil society to commit to these processes.
 
 ROADMAP
 • Continue the open-data provision of legal and legislative resources that already exist - Continue the opening of legal data in reusable formats
 • Continue the collaborative process with civil society for the production of innovative services and open source tools facilitating the understanding of texts and their preparation
 • On the Digital Bill, continue the participative process in collaboration with civil society by opening the draft bill (“avant projet de loi”) to consultation for citizens to comment it and suggest amendments
column17: FR0015 開放法律資源 Open Legal Resources
Full Text 中文:
賭注
 了解法律和訴諸司法是法治的支柱。在數位時代，這一雄心壯志不僅限於傳播法律內容，還需要了解法理學，所有公民都有可能基於該內容開發創新工具或服務（由於其在開放數據中的可用性），以及激發和成功調動公民的專業知識和貢獻的能力。
 
 背景與目標
 法國已於 2001 年創建了一項透過網路傳播法律的主要公共服務。根據 2002 年 8 月 7 日修訂的關於透過網路傳播法律的公共服務的第 2002-1064 號法令的條款，Légifrance 網站旨在方便公眾獲取現行文本和判例。它已經提供了對所有法律來源（立法和監管文本、條約、法典、憲法委員會、國務委員會和法國最高法院的判例等）的免費、普遍訪問。法律數據和與法律法案或其準備有關的數據的開放數據提供使公民更好地了解整個立法過程，利用這些數據開發工具或應用程序並積極參與民主辯論。
 因此，隨著總理辦公室法律和行政資訊部（DILA）資料庫的開放資料發布以及「開放法律」計劃的建立，法律資料的開放成為政府行動的核心。該計劃催生了許多由新創公司、研究人員和公司開發的創新應用程序，並獲得了獎勵。公共合約聲明官方公報 (BOAMP)、民商公告官方公報 (BODACC) 和強制性法律聲明官方公報 (BALO) 的公開數據發布將補充此方法。 20 最後，公民就政府法案或在準備法案之前進行協商能夠制定有效的公共決策，可以重振民主。在準備數位法案時，法國數位委員會協調了為期六個月的線上諮詢（請參閱「方法」附錄中的詳細資訊和數據）。它展示了政府和民間社會致力於這些進程的程度和能力。
 
 路線圖
 • 繼續開放現有法律和立法資源的數據 - 繼續以可重複使用的格式開放法律數據
 • 繼續與民間社會合作，提供創新服務和開源工具，促進文本的理解及其準備
 • 在數位法案方面，繼續與民間社會合作參與進程，將法案草案（「avant projet de loi」）公開徵求意見，讓公民發表評論並提出修改建議

Commitment Title: Instill a Greater Sense of Responsibility and Protect Agents Regarding the Prevention of Conflicts of Interest
Full Text:
STAKES The importance given to public officials’ exemplary behavior in their day-to-day actions for the general interest is an eminent element of the French republican model. The transposition of measures on the transparency in public life, to public agent, will further expand exemplarity within the civil service and obligations contained in the general statute of civil servants. A system will also be introduced to protect civil servants acting in good faith to report the existence of a conflict of interest.
 
 CONTEXT & AIM 
 More than thirty years after the enactment of the July 13th 1983 Bill, the bill on ethics and the rights and obligations of officials36 , when adopted, will update and complement the main fundamentals of the general statute of officials. In particular, it aims to apply to civil servants and members of administrative and financial jurisdictions, mechanisms on the prevention of conflicts of interests detailed in the bill on transparency in public life. The most exposed officials and administrative and financial magistrates will thus be required to complete declarations of interests before their appointments. Information on their assets will be passed on to the High Authority for Transparency in Public Life. An obligation to prevent and to resolve any conflict of interest will also be instituted. An offset mechanism has been put in place and a “management mandate” system will become mandatory for agents particularly concerned. Finally, a protection mechanism has been introduced in the general statute of officials to allow an agent acting in good faith to report the existence of a conflict of interest without fear of reprisals. The bill thus consecrates the active role to be played by each official and non-permanent agent under public law in the prevention of conflicts of interest: each agent is to act as the first guardian of ethical principles inherent to a civil servant position. This accountability of each public agent in the prevention of conflicts of interest complements an approach which, until now, has been under the sole responsibility of higher authorities of agents exposed to risk. 
 
 ROADMAP
 • Appoint an official, a service, or a legal entity under public law to provide agents under their authority with all relevant advice in respect of ethical obligations and principles
 • Introduce legal provisions to better prevent conflicts of interests and to protect civil servants 
 - Put in place a system for agents responsible for certain functions to declare their interests 
 - Reinforce and widen the area of competence of the ethics committee, which will be expanded to include the prevention of conflicts of interest and reinforced in the area of the control of civil servant’s transitions to the private sector 
 - Introduce a protection mechanism in the general statute of officials, so as to allow an agent acting in good faith to report the existence of a conflict of interest without fear of reprisals
column17: FR0026 防止利益衝突 Protect Against Conflicts of Interest
Full Text 中文:
利益 重視公職人員在日常行動中為公眾利益所做的模範行為，這是法國共和模式的突出要素。將公共生活透明度措施轉變為公共機構，將進一步擴大公務員隊伍的典範以及公務員總法規中所載的義務。也將引入一個制度來保護公務員善意報告利益衝突的存在。
 
 背景與目標 
 1983 年 7 月 13 日法案頒布三十多年後，有關官員道德和權利與義務的法案36一旦獲得通過，將更新和補充官員總法規的主要基本原則。特別是，它旨在將公共生活透明法案中詳細規定的預防利益衝突機制適用於公務員以及行政和財務管轄區的成員。因此，暴露程度最高的官員以及行政和財政法官將被要求在任命前完成利益申報。他們的資產資訊將傳遞給公共生活透明度高級管理局。也將規定預防和解決任何利益衝突的義務。抵銷機制已經到位，「管理授權」制度將成為特別關注的代理人的強制性制度。最後，在官員一般法規中引入了保護機制，允許善意行事的代理人報告利益衝突的存在，而不必擔心遭到報復。因此，該法案規定每個官方和非常任代理人根據公法在防止利益衝突方面發揮積極作用：每個代理人都應充當公務員職位固有道德原則的第一守護者。每個公共機構在防止利益衝突方面的責任補充了迄今為止一直由面臨風險的機構的上級當局單獨負責的方法。 
 
 路線圖
 • 根據公法指定一名官員、服務機構或法律實體，向其授權的代理人提供有關道德義務和原則的所有相關建議
 • 引入法律規定，更好地防止利益衝突並保護公務員 
 - 建立負責某些職能的代理人申報利益的製度 
 - 加強和擴大道德委員會的職權範圍，將其範圍擴大到包括預防利益衝突，並加強對公務員向私營部門過渡的控制領域 
 - 在官員總章程中引入保護機制，讓善意的代理人舉報利益衝突的存在，而不必擔心遭到報復

Commitment Title: Elaborate Freedom of Information Act
Full Text:
Freedom of Information legislation is one of the key tools for transparent and accountable governments. In this regard, it is essential for the legislation to provide high standards of openness and accountability, while its implementation in practice should not lead to unreasonable spending of public resources and accordingly tax payers’ money.
Therefore,  refinement of  the  laws on  freedom of  information and  ensuring  its compliance  with international standards is one of the objectives of the Georgian government.
Currently, the norms regulating access to public information are scattered in several laws, as well as significant difficulties are encountered in practical implementation of legislation. Taking into consideration practical challenges, elaboration of special law aims to eradicate legislative gaps and consolidate existing legal provisions in a separate act, which in turn will improve the practice of access to information and support the government, as well as civil society and wide community to establish open and accountable, rational and optimized civil service. The special act will emphasize openness policy of the government and will ease the work of the professionals involved in the area.
Ministry of Justice of Georgia will coordinate elaboration of freedom of information law in close cooperation with civil society. In order to ensure broad consultation process and wide involvement of stakeholders a special working group will be created. Based on consultations and international expertise the special working group will elaborate the new provisions of freedom of information in compliance with international standards. The first draft will be completed in spring, 2015.
column17: GE0020 資訊自由法 (FOIA) 草案 Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Draft
Full Text 中文:
資訊自由立法是透明和負責任的政府的關鍵工具之一。就此而言，立法必須提供高標準的公開性和問責性，而其在實踐中的實施不應導致公共資源和納稅人資金的不合理支出。
因此，完善資訊自由法並確保其符合國際標準是格魯吉亞政府的目標之一。
目前，公共資訊公開的規範分散在多部法律中，立法在具體實施上遇到很大困難。考慮到實際挑戰，制定特別法律的目的是消除立法空白，將現有法律條款整合為單獨的法案，從而改善獲取資訊的做法，支持政府、民間社會和廣大社區建立公開負責、合理優化的公務員隊伍。該特別法案將強調政府的開放政策，並將減輕該領域專業人員的工作壓力。
格魯吉亞司法部將與民間社會密切合作，協調資訊自由法的製定。為了確保廣泛的協商過程和利害關係人的廣泛參與，將成立一個特別工作小組。特別工作小組將在協商和國際專業知識的基礎上，制定符合國際標準的資訊自由新規定。第一稿將於 2015 年春季完成。
Lead Institution: Ministry of Justice of Georgia; Anti-Corruption Council of Georgia

Parliament of Georgia, Open Society Foundation – Georgia, Institute for the Development of Freedom of

Commitment Title: Development of the Freedom of Information Law
Short Title: Development of the Freedom of Information Law
Full Text: Development of the Freedom of Information Law. Improving legal framework of freedom of information and elaborating new provisions in compliance with international standards which are gradually being implemented, is one of the top priorities for the government of Georgia. In the framework of the first Action Plan of Georgia, decree of the government of Goegira “About the Form of the Electronic Request of Information and Proactive Disclosure of Public Information” was adopted. Through this reform, Georgia became one of seven finalist countries at the “Bright Spots” competition held by the OGP Global Summit in London. The goal of the competition was to demonstrate successful reforms implemented as a result of civil society-government cooperation. At the next stage, the government started more ambitious project of elaborating a stand-along act on freedom of information. To carry out a wide-scale consultations, a special working group comprised of representatives from the Ministry of Justice, civil society, and independent experts was created. This working group carried out an important work: (1) to identified key problematic issues in the field, thematic working groups were established; (2) the first version of the project with potential amendments was drafted and submitted to the Anti-Corruption Council; (3) meetings with the focus groups (judges, journalists, persons responsible for information disclosure) were held; (4) the draft law prepared by the working group was presented to the Ministry of Justice; (5) the draft project underwent primary international expertise. Ministry of Justice will negotiate the draft law with all governmental agencies in the framework of the given Action Plan. After the detailed review of the draft law, in the framework of the Anti-corruption Council activities, Ministry of Justice will conduct one more consultation round with governmental and civil society organizations to finalize the text of the draft law. Implementation date: 2016-2017;
column17: GE0048 資訊自由法的發展 Development of the Freedom of Information Law
Full Text 中文: 資訊自由法的發展。完善資訊自由的法律框架，制定符合國際標準的新規定並逐步實施，是格魯吉亞政府的首要任務之一。在喬治亞第一個行動計畫的框架內，通過了戈埃吉拉政府法令「關於電子資訊請求和主動公開公共資訊的形式」。透過這項改革，喬治亞成為倫敦OGP全球高峰會「亮點」競賽的七個入圍國家之一。競賽的目的是展示民間社會與政府合作所實施的成功改革。在下一階段，政府啟動了更雄心勃勃的項目，制定關於資訊自由的獨立法案。為了進行廣泛的磋商，成立了一個由司法部、民間社會和獨立專家代表組成的特別工作小組。該工作小組進行了一項重要工作：（1）針對本領域存在的重點問題，成立了專題工作小組； (2) 起草了可能進行修改的項目第一版並提交給反腐敗委員會； （三）與焦點小組（法官、記者、資訊揭露負責人）召開會議； （四）工作小組起草的法律草案提交給司法部； （5）計畫草案經過了初步的國際專家論證。司法部將在既定行動計畫的框架內與所有政府機構就法律草案進行談判。在法律草案進行詳細審查後，司法部將在反腐敗委員會活動的框架內與政府和民間社會組織再進行一輪磋商，以最終確定法律草案文本。實施日期：2016-2017年；

Commitment Title: Promoting and Monitoring the Implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by the Parliament of Georgia
Short Title 中文: 促進和監測永續發展目標
Full Text:
1. Promoting and Monitoring the Implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by the Parliament of Georgia
 Lead Agency Parliament of Georgia 
 
 Partners Public Institution  
 Civil/International/Private Sector  Initiator: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP); 
 Current Situation and Challenges  United Nations Development Programme (UNDP):
 Since joining the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), the Government of Georgia defined country-adjusted targets and indicators to implement the Goals at the national level. The Sustainable Development Agenda 2030 unequivocally recognizes the significant role of Parliaments in the implementation of SDGs, which includes the implementation of the SDG 16 (16.6 – “Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels”; 16.7 – “Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels”). Simultaneously, ensuring maximum openness, transparency and accountability of the process is crucial for ultimate success in this endeavor. The first steps were taken with the support of the European Union and UNDP: 
 • A new component was added to the action plans of Parliamentary Committees, which determines the compliance of the activities defined by the Committees’ action plans with the respective SDGs and demonstrates close connection between the national policy and the global agenda, thus also increasing the awareness of various stakeholders on SDGs in the process; 
 • A number of Committees have already committed through their action plans to hear the reports of relevant Ministries on the progress made towards implementing the SDGs. 
 Besides, in June 2018, with the support of the Swedish Government, UNDP and Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU), and based on the IPU/UNDP methodology, the Parliament conducted a self-assessment exercise to check SDG readiness. The Exercise defined the role of the Parliament in the fulfillment of 2030 Agenda and outlined possible actions for SDGs implementation. 
 At this stage, the Parliament shall elaborate an action plan based on the results of the above self-assessment which shall include the introduction of parliamentary mechanisms and activities related to the Parliament’s lawmaking, oversight and citizen engagement functions. This will increase the involvement of the Parliament in SDG implementation and monitoring and ensure the institutionalization of this process in the Parliament. 
 
 Main Objective Increase Parliamentary involvement in the SDGs implementation and monitoring through civil society engagement and based on openness and transparency principles.

1. 喬治亞議會促進和監督永續發展目標（SDG）的實施
 格魯吉亞議會領導機構 
 
 合作夥伴 公共機構  
 民間/國際/私部門發起者：聯合國開發計畫署（UNDP）； 
 現狀與挑戰 聯合國開發計畫署（UNDP）：
 自從加入永續發展目標（SDG）以來，喬治亞政府制定了國家調整目標和指標，以在國家層級實施這些目標。 2030 年永續發展議程明確承認議會在實施永續發展目標中的重要作用，其中包括實施永續發展目標16（16.6 – 「在各級建立有效、負責和透明的機構」；16.7 – 「確保回應性、包容性、各級的參與性和代表性決策」）。同時，確保這一過程的最大公開性、透明度和問責制對於這項努力的最終成功至關重要。第一步是在歐盟和聯合國開發計畫署的支持下採取的： 
 • 議會委員會的行動計劃中增加了一個新的組成部分，該組成部分確定了委員會行動計劃所定義的活動是否符合各自的可持續發展目標，並表明國家政策與全球議程之間的密切聯繫，從而也提高了認識在此過程中各利害關係人對永續發展目標的看法； 
 • 有些委員會已承諾透過其行動計畫聽取相關部會關於落實永續發展目標進度的報告。 
 此外，2018年6月，在瑞典政府、聯合國開發計畫署和各國議會聯盟（IPU）的支持下，議會根據各國議會聯盟/聯合國開發計畫署的方法，開展了自我評估活動，以檢查永續發展目標的準備情況。這項演習明確了議會在實現 2030 年議程中的作用，並概述了落實永續發展目標可能採取的行動。

Commitment Title: Adoption of the “Open Data Act”
Short Title: Adoption of the Open Data Act
Full Text:
Description of the current state and the challenge 

According to the Council of Europe's definition, open data is the publication of data and information in a format that may be freely used, modified and shared.9 The accessibility to open data enables businesses, NGOs, and government agencies to seamlessly access the required data, utilize it for developing applications and electronic services, and derive economic benefits. While government agencies in Georgia process open data, only a few of them make it available in a machine-readable format. In response to this challenge, an open data portal (data.gov.ge) was established as part of the Open Government Action Plan of Georgia for 2014-2015. This portal provides information from various government agencies, including data on procurement and government expenses, in an open format. The portal is administered by the LEPL – Digital Governance Agency of the Ministry of Justice of Georgia. While the open data portal exists, it should be noted that publication of data on the platform is voluntary, therefor it does not cover all government agencies. Moreover, there is a low level of awareness regarding both data publishing within government agencies and the use of the platform among the general public. Additionally, the growth in the volume of data published on the portal is impeded by the outdated technical and systemic infrastructure currently in place on data.gov.ge that needs to be addressed.

Brief description of the commitment 

As part of this commitment, the Administration of the Government of Georgia, in close collaboration with the LEPL – Digital Governance Agency, will develop a legal framework for open data. This framework will mandate government agencies to publish the open data they own on the portal Data.gov.ge. The commitment aims to enhance standards for the proactive publication of public information and open data.

Milestones | Expected Outputs

2.1 Preparation and approval of the Open Data Act (Government decree) | A decree to regulate open data is adopted by the Government of Georgia

2.2 Training of government agency employees to work with open data | At least 10 employees from 5 government agencies are trained on open data

2.3 Development of open data production and processing systems | Open data production and processing systems are implemented in 5 government agencies

2.4 Updating of the Open Data Portal (data.gov.ge) | Open Data Portal updated

2.5 Regular publication/updating of open data by agencies on data.gov.ge | Open data is regularly published and updated by agencies on the portal data.gov.ge

Indicator 

1. Government decree on open data is adopted 
2. At least 10 employees from 5 government agencies are trained in open data 
3. Open data systems are implemented in 5 government agencies 
4. Data.gov.ge portal is updated 
5. Open data is regularly published and updated by agencies on the data.gov.ge portal
column17: GE0095 通過開放資料法案 Adoption of the Open Data Act
Full Text 中文:
當前狀態和挑戰的描述 

根據歐洲委員會的定義，開放資料是以可自由使用、修改和共享的格式發布資料和資訊。來開發應用程式和電子服務，並獲得經濟效益。雖然喬治亞州的政府機構處理開放數據，但只有少數政府機構以機器可讀的格式提供數據。為了應對這項挑戰，作為 2014-2015 年格魯吉亞開放政府行動計畫的一部分，建立了開放資料入口網站 (data.gov.ge)。該門戶以開放格式提供來自各個政府機構的信息，包括採購和政府支出數據。此入口網站由 LEPL（格魯吉亞司法部數位治理機構）管理。儘管存在開放資料門戶，但應該注意的是，平台上資料的發布是自願的，因此它並不涵蓋所有政府機構。此外，無論是政府機構內部的資料發布或是公眾對平台的使用，認知度都較低。此外，data.gov.ge 目前過時的技術和系統基礎設施阻礙了入口網站上發布的資料量的成長，這一點需要解決。

承諾的簡要說明 

作為這項承諾的一部分，喬治亞政府行政部門將與 LEPL（數位治理機構）密切合作，制定開放資料的法律框架。該框架將要求政府機構在 Data.gov.ge 入口網站上發布他們擁有的開放資料。該承諾旨在提高主動發佈公共資訊和開放資料的標準。

里程碑 |預期產出

2.1 制定和批准《開放資料法》（政府法令）|喬治亞政府通過了一項規範開放資料的法令

2.2 訓練政府機構員工使用開放資料|來自 5 個政府機構的至少 10 名員工接受了開放資料培訓

2.3 開放資料生產與處理系統的開發| 5個政府機構實施開放資料生產處理系統

2.4 更新開放資料入口網站 (data.gov.ge) |開放資料入口網站已更新

2.5 各機構在 data.gov.ge 上定期發布/更新開放資料 |各機構定期在 data.gov.ge 入口網站上發布和更新開放數據

指標 

1. 通過關於開放資料的政府法令 
2. 5 個政府機構的至少 10 名員工接受過開放資料培訓 
3. 5個政府機構實施開放資料系統 
4. Data.gov.ge 入口網站更新 
5. 各機構定期在 data.gov.ge 入口網站上發布和更新開放數據

Commitment Title: Increasing the transparency of the state grant funding system
Short Title: Increase Transparency of State Grant Funding System
Short Title 中文: 提高國家撥款系統的透明度
Full Text:
Description of the current state and the challenge 

Based on the recommendations from non-governmental organizations, OGP Georgia Forum members, the Administration of the Government of Georgia, in collaboration with partner agencies, initiated reforms to the existing system of allocating grant funding by state/public institutions in 2018. As evidenced by practice, Georgian legislation lacks provisions encompassing general principles and procedures for the allocation of grants by ministries and legal entities of public law. Additionally, there is no uniform legal standard governing the provision of grants by government agencies. Moreover, certain government agencies are not integrated into the existing government grant system. According to the final report on the implementation of the OGP Georgia Action Plan 2018-2019, collaborative efforts were initiated in 2018 by the Administration of the Government of Georgia and the OGP Georgia Forum member N(N)LE Civil Society Institute to reform the system of allocating grant funding by state/public institutions. A working group was formed, consisting of representatives from the Administration of the Government of Georgia, the Civil Society Institute, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Regional Development and Infrastructure, and the Public Procurement Agency. Numerous meetings were conducted, resulting in the preparation of multiple versions of draft amendments to the Law of Georgia "On Grants.” Several issues were agreed upon, while the need for additional work on certain topics was acknowledged. Depending on the significance of each issue, it is necessary to continue the ongoing process, conduct further consultations, and reach a consensus on the final version of the proposed draft law. 

Brief description of the commitment 

The commitment entails the completion of consultations on amendments to the Law of Georgia "On Grants," the preparation of the final version of the draft law, and its submission to the Parliament of Georgia for approval.

Milestones | Expected Output

3.1 Conducting consultations with stakeholders to prepare legal amendments | Consultations with various government agencies, public organizations and experts on the preparation of amendments to legislation are completed

3.2 Preparation and discussion of draft amendments to the Law of Georgia “On Grants” | Draft amendments to the Law of Georgia “On Grants” are prepared and discussed within the framework of the OGP Georgia Forum

3.3 Submission of the draft amendments to the Parliament of Georgia | Draft amendments to the law are submitted to the Parliament of Georgia

Indicator 

Submission of draft amendments to the law of Georgia “On Grants” to the Parliament of Georgia

當前狀態和挑戰的描述 

根據非政府組織、OGP 格魯吉亞論壇成員的建議，格魯吉亞政府行政部門與夥伴機構合作，於 2018 年啟動了對現有國家/公共機構贈款分配製度的改革。和法律實體分配補助金的一般原則和程序的規定。此外，政府機構提供補助也沒有統一的法律標準。此外，某些政府機關並未納入現有的政府補助體系。根據《2018-2019年OGP格魯吉亞行動計劃》實施情況最終報告，格魯吉亞政府行政部門和OGP格魯吉亞論壇成員N(N)LE民間社會研究所於2018年發起合作，改革該制度國家/公共機構分配贈款資金的問題。成立了一個工作小組，由格魯吉亞政府行政部門、民間社會研究所、財政部、區域發展和基礎設施部以及公共採購局的代表組成。舉行了多次會議，制定了喬治亞州「贈款法」修正案草案的多個版本。就幾個問題達成了一致，同時承認需要就某些主題開展額外工作，具體取決於每個問題的重要性，有必要繼續正在進行的進程，進行進一步磋商，並就擬議的最終版本達成共識。起草法案。 

承諾的簡要說明 

該承諾包括完成對格魯吉亞「贈款法」修正案的磋商，準備該法律草案的最終版本，並將其提交給格魯吉亞議會批准。

Commitment Title: Defining key housing policy issues within the legal framework of social welfare reform
Short Title: Housing Policy and Social Welfare Reform
Short Title 中文: 房屋政策與社會福利改革
Full Text:
Description of the current state and the challenge 

Currently, the country lacks uniform statistics on homelessness and housing policy. The availability of such data is crucial for two main reasons: firstly, for planning effective housing policies and establishing the right priorities, and secondly, for monitoring the effectiveness of existing policies and specific measures. In line with international standards, housing policies must be formulated based on sector-specific statistics. 

Brief description of the commitment 

The absence of information regarding the extent of homelessness, its root causes, and the challenges faced by homeless and at-risk individuals, leads to a fragmented and inconsistent approach to addressing homelessness relying on short-term management principles. Thus, the country's legal and regulatory framework must include an obligation to collect and process data in the area of homelessness and housing policy, encompassing: - Legal definition of the "homeless person” - Preparation and implementation of a unified methodology for creating, collecting, and processing data. - Processing of statistics on various aspects, including gender, age, social status, causes, forms, and individual needs of homelessness. To achieve these objectives, it is crucial to determine the entity responsible for producing statistics and the methods for systematizing them. Moreover, the development of this methodology must be preceded by the creation and approval of the appropriate legislative framework.

Milestones | Expected Output

7.1 Preparation of the legislative framework for housing as part of social welfare reform | Legislative framework related to housing policy is developed as part of social welfare reform with the participation of diverse stakeholders

7.2. Collection and processing of data in the field of homelessness and housing policy | A unified methodology for collecting and processing data in the field of housing is developed

Indicator 

1. Legislative framework for housing prepared. 
2. A unified methodology for collecting and processing data on housing developed.
column17: GE0100 房屋政策與社會福利改革 Housing Policy and Social Welfare Reform
Full Text 中文:
當前狀態和挑戰的描述 

目前，該國缺乏有關無家可歸者和住房政策的統一統計數據。此類數據的可用性至關重要，主要有兩個原因：首先，對於規劃有效的住房政策和確定正確的優先事項，其次，對於監測現有政策和具體措施的有效性。與國際標準接軌，住房政策必須根據部門統計數據制定。 

承諾的簡要說明 

由於缺乏有關無家可歸的程度、其根本原因以及無家可歸和高危險個人所面臨的挑戰的信息，導致依靠短期管理原則解決無家可歸問題的方法支離破碎且不一致。因此，國家的法律和監管框架必須包括收集和處理無家可歸者和住房政策領域數據的義務，包括： - “無家可歸者”的法律定義- 制定和實施統一的方法，用於創建、收集、 - 處理無家可歸者各方面的統計數據，包括性別、年齡、社會地位、原因、形式和個人需求。在製定這種方法之前必須建立並批准適當的立法框架。

7.2.無家可歸和住房政策領域數據的收集和處理|開發了收集和處理住房領域數據的統一方法

Commitment Title: Accessibility of websites and mobile applications
Short Title: Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications
Short Title 中文: 網站和行動應用程式的可訪問性
Full Text:
Description of the current state and the challenge 

The accessibility of government websites poses a significant challenge. On one hand, there is no established standard to which websites and applications must adhere. On the other hand, the absence of such standards leads to the adoption of divergent approaches in practice, contributing to the development of a less customer-oriented approach. Moreover, the same information and/or service may be duplicated across multiple websites and/or applications, indicating a misuse of resources. 

Brief description of the commitment 

The initiative seeks to standardize government agencies' websites and applications by establishing a uniform standard to streamline user access. It's worth noting that there exists a European Union standard in the form of European Directive (EU) 2016/2102. While this Directive is not explicitly incorporated into the Association Agreement, Georgia's progressive alignment with EU standards in any capacity signifies a positive advancement.

Milestones | Expected Output

8.1 Research best practices for achieving uniform website accessibility | Best practices in achieving uniform website accessibility are researched

8.2. Present the website and mobile application accessibility issue to the Governmental Commission on EGovernance for consideration | Results and recommendations from the best practice review on achieving uniform website accessibility are presented to the Governmental Commission on EGovernance

8.3 Prepare legal amendments regarding the accessibility of websites and mobile applications | Legal amendments to the website and mobile application accessibility are adopted, reflecting the European Directive (EU) 2016/2102

Indicator 

Relevant legal amendments on the accessibility of websites and mobile applications adopted, reflecting the European Directive (EU) 2016/2102.
column17: GE0101 網站和行動應用程式的可訪問性 Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications
Full Text 中文:
當前狀態和挑戰的描述 

政府網站的可訪問性提出了重大挑戰。一方面，沒有網站和應用程式必須遵守的既定標準。另一方面，缺乏此類標準導致在實踐中採用不同的方法，從而導致開發不太以客戶為導向的方法。此外，相同的資訊和/或服務可能在多個網站和/或應用程式中重複，這表示資源的濫用。 

承諾的簡要說明 

該計劃旨在透過建立統一標準來簡化用戶訪問，從而標準化政府機構的網站和應用程式。值得注意的是，存在歐洲指令 (EU) 2016/2102 形式的歐盟標準。雖然該指令沒有明確納入聯合協​​議，但喬治亞在任何方面逐步與歐盟標準保持一致都標誌著積極的進步。

Commitment Title: Drafting and shepherding through Parliament of a Transparency Act
Full Text:
What is the public problem that the commitment will address? Access to official information and public records is possible through many channels. The legal preconditions for that access, however, are enshrined in various laws. The following are unclear: conditions of access, permissible reasons for refusals and exceptions, formats to be used, obligations on providers to prepare files, possibilities for reuse or searchability tools. Elements of them overlap; some are contradictory. Publication practice to date has been mixed and is not yet entirely consistent, active and structured. The information and data that are made public could be made easier to find. In some areas, the rules for reuse are unclear. 

What is the commitment? The Federal Government will introduce a bill which refines the legal basis for access to information and data and shepherd it through Parliament. It is examining to what extent existing freedom of information laws can be amalgamated and unified. The intention is also to improve the substantive criteria for granting access. For certain categories of information and data, an obligation to publish proactively is to be created. A centralised transparency platform is to ensure that, once published, information and data can be found. The law will establish a legal entitlement to open data. 

How will the commitment contribute to solving the public problem? The Transparency Act will create a cohesive legal framework governing access to and reuse of official information and data. This will result in legal certainty and clarity and will improve the availability of data. Expanded publication obligations and access rights will mean more information and data available to the individual and to the public at large. The obligation to publish proactively and the legal entitlement of the individual to open data will contribute to more effective accessing practice. A centralised transparency platform will make things easier to find. Freedom of information and open data will be brought together. The right of the individual to access information, formerly vouchsafed through freedom of information, will be brought closer to the legal regime governing open data by the obligation to publish proactively; the obligation to make public records accessible as open data, formerly enshrined in generally applicable law, will come into closer alignment with freedom of information as a result of the legal entitlement of the individual. This closer alignment will serve to better satisfy the demand for information from policymakers, industry, academia and society, to the benefit of the data economy as a whole. 

Why is this commitment relevant to OGP values? In creating the Transparency Act, the Federal Government is making great strides in the direc- tion of openness and transparency. The legally enshrined routes for accessing information are to be imbued with a new quality, improve cooperation within the government, foster oversight of administration and government, and enhance people’s options for participating in the political process. The resultant availability of data for business, researchers, civil society and the state will serve the common good. 

Additional information: Objectives from the coalition agreement between the SPD, Alliance 90/The Greens and the FDP for the 20th legislative term

Government bill | End of 2024 

Entry into force of the Act
column17: DE0044 制定透明度法案 Creation of Transparency Act
Full Text 中文:
該承諾將解決哪些公共問題？可透過多種管道取得官方資訊和公共記錄。然而，各種法​​律都規定了這種訪問的法律先決條件。以下內容尚不清楚：存取條件、拒絕和例外的允許原因、使用的格式、提供者準備文件的義務、重複使用或可搜尋工具的可能性。它們的元素重疊；有些是矛盾的。迄今為止，出版實踐參差不齊，尚未完全一致、活躍和結構化。公開的資訊和數據可以更容易找到。在某些領域，重複利用的規則尚不明確。 

承諾是什麼？聯邦政府將提出一項法案，完善獲取資訊和數據的法律基礎，並透過議會進行引導。它正在研究現有的資訊自由法可以在多大程度上合併和統一。目的還在於改進授予准入的實質標準。對於某些類別的資訊和數據，應規定主動發布的義務。一個集中的透明平台是為了確保資訊和數據一旦發布就可以找到。該法律將確立開放資料的合法權利。 

該承諾將如何有助於解決公共問題？ 《透明度法案》將創建一個統一的法律框架，管理官方資訊和資料的存取和重複使用。這將帶來法律的確定性和清晰度，並將提高數據的可用性。擴大出版義務和存取權將意味著個人和廣大公眾可以獲得更多的資訊和資料。主動發布的義務和個人開放資料的合法權利將有助於更有效的存取實踐。集中式透明平台將使事情更容易找到。資訊自由和開放資料將結合在一起。先前透過資訊自由獲得的個人獲取資訊的權利，將透過主動發布的義務而更加接近管理開放資料的法律制度；由於個人的法律權利，先前在普遍適用的法律中規定的將公共記錄作為開放資料提供的義務將與資訊自由更加一致。這種更緊密的結合將有助於更好地滿足政策制定者、工業界、學術界和社會對資訊的需求，從而造福整個數據經濟。 

為什麼這項承諾與 OGP 價值觀相關？在製定《透明度法案》時，聯邦政府正在朝著開放和透明的方向邁出一大步。依法獲得資訊的途徑將被賦予新的品質，改善政府內部的合作，加強對行政和政府的監督，並增加人們參與政治過程的選擇。由此為企業、研究人員、民間社會和國家提供的數據將服務於共同利益。

Commitment Title: Fiscal Responsibility
Full Text:
The Government of Ghana will, within the two-year period (2013 - 2014) take concrete action to strengthen the management of public expenditure by working closely with relevant stakeholders to introduce the appropriate legislation in the Ghana Parliament.
Towards this end, the Government will consistently work towards the passage of the Fiscal Responsibility Act that strengthens mechanisms for fiscal discipline and provides the citizenry with clear indicators to determine when the Government is veering off approved expenditures in a way that threatens fiscal stability. Fiscal responsibility legislation is critically necessary to reverse, for example, the trend of overspending associated with Ghana’s electoral cycle.  
- Conduct a national consultation process with think-tanks, labour unions, private sector organizations on the necessity, content, limits, merits and demerits of a Fiscal Responsibility Act
-Finalize a report on the national consultation process
-Prepare and place a draft Fiscal Responsibility Bill for Cabinet approval
-Introduce Draft Bill in Parliament for debate and passage
-Educate the public on content and benefits of the Fiscal Responsibility Act
column17: GH0001 財政責任 Fiscal Responsibility
Full Text 中文:
加納政府將在兩年內（2013-2014年）採取具體行動，與相關利害關係人密切合作，在加納議會提出適當的立法，加強公共支出的管理。
為此，政府將持續努力通過《財政責任法》，加強財政紀律機制，並為公民提供明確的指標，以確定政府何時以威脅財政穩定的方式偏離批准的支出。例如，財政責任立法對於扭轉與加納選舉週期相關的超支趨勢至關重要。  
- 與智庫、工會、私部門組織就《財政責任法》的必要性、內容、限制、優點和缺點進行全國協商
- 完成全國磋商進程報告
- 準備並提交財政責任法案草案供內閣批准
-向議會提出法案草案供辯論和通過
- 向公眾宣傳《財政責任法》的內容和好處

Commitment Title: Right to Information
Full Text:
The Government of Ghana has, since 2010, been working very hard on a major instrument of transparency in the shape of a Right to Information Bill which is currently pending before Parliament. To give transparency a badly needed shot in the arm, Government undertakes to work hand-in-hand with Parliament to ensure the early passage of the Bill. To achieve this undertaking, Government will support every effort to ensure an immediate resolution of all outstanding issues between Parliament and CSO supporters of the Bill. Actions:
• Convene a weekend retreat of the Coalition on Right to Information Bill and the Parliamentary Committee on Communications and the Parliamentary Committee on Legal, Constitutional and Parliamentary Affairs in order to thrash out the necessary compromises on the Bill
• Pass the Right to Information Bill by the end of 2013.
• Disseminate information and educate the public on the Law.
column17: GH0003 知情權 Right to Information

自 2010 年以來，加納政府一直在努力製定一項重要的透明度文書，即《資訊權法案》，目前正在等待議會審議。為了讓透明度打一劑急需的強心劑，政府承諾與議會攜手合作，確保法案早日通過。為了實現這一目標，政府將支持一切努力，確保立即解決議會與法案的公民社會組織支持者之間的所有懸而未決的問題。行動：
