Commitment Title: Timely production and publication of Annual Audit Reports
Full Text:
Problem/Issue to be addressed The Office of the Auditor General produces four Annual Reports and the reports are based on the timely release of the Financial Statements from State Agencies including Statutory Authorities and State-Owned Enterprises. However, for the last couple of years, those reports have not been produced as required by the Audit Act. The agencies delayed in submitting their financial statements on time. The public fund appropriated to the agencies and used are not reported, published and event tabled on the Parliament through the Parliament Audit Committee.

Main Objective The financial auditing of state agencies including statutory authorities and state-owned enterprises is to ensure that the agencies are accountable to their citizens in the use of public funds. It is also to minimise the misuse of public funds and promote transparency and accountability in the government institutions and state-owned enterprises.

Brief Description of Commitment The commitment basically focuses on the public finance and expenditure report on the fund’s allocation for service delivery in national and sub-national levels and the state-owned enterprises. It is a mechanism in which the Auditor General keeps accountable on the funds being used for both operational and capital investment. OGP through this commitment will facilitate the timely release of the financial statements from departments, statutorily authorities, subnational governments, and state-owned enterprises. The Office of the Auditor General will then use the financial statements to produce four (4) reports; hence reports for: departments, subnational government, statutory authorities, and state-owned enterprises. Through the Commitment will enable the Parliament Accounts Committee to work through which the audit reports will be made available in the Parliament.

OGP Challenge address by the Commitment Government departments/agencies and other subsidiary bodies have not been submitting timely financial statements to the Department of Finance to then submit to the Office of the Auditor General for audit and presentation to Parliament, thus resulting in PNG’s annual audit reports not being made available to the public in a timely manner. Make fiscal data available in an accurate and timely manner so that the citizens and the stakeholder of this country will have to know how money is coming in and how money is going out of the country. This includes having timely annual audit reports made public aware on the AGO website and other gov’t websites (such as Treasury, who publish the in-year reports).

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. The financial auditing is done in order to know how public funds are managed at the national and sub national levels and the government make better analysis on the next budget for effective service delivery. It is equally important to maintain PNG’s eligibility as a member of the OGP to enable PNG to exercise a leadership role in governance issues in the region.

Ambition Briefly described the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness The financial auditing of the use of public funds is an important element of promoting transparency and accountability in the government process. The annual financial auditing and publication of those audit reports will enable agencies that receives public funds to improve on the use of public funds, hence improve accountability.

Milestones Activity Descriptions Start Date End Date

Phase 1 – Release of Financial Statements and Production of Annual Audit Report

1.1 Financial Statements All departments, statutory authorities, subnational governments, and state-owned enterprises to release their financial statements on time for the Office of the Auditor General produce the audit reports April, 2022 and April, 2024 March, 2023 and March, 2024

1.2 Audit Report Produce the four parts of the Audit Reports on an annual basis February, 2023 and February 2024 November, 2023 & November, 2024

1.3 Audit Report accessed by Parliamentary Audit Committee Access the audit report by the Parliamentary Audit Committee October, 2023, October, 2024 End of October & end of October, 2024

1.4 Audit Report tabled in Parliament Table All four Audit Reports on the Floor of the Parliament November, 2022, November, 2023 & November, 2024 November, 2022 & November, 2023

1.5 Publication of Audit Report Publish the annual audit report on the established media outlets December, 2022 & December, 2023 End of December, 2023 & end of December, 2024 

Phase 2: Review of the Audit Act 1989

1.1 The Review Committee Establish the Audit Act Review Committee May, 2022 End of May, 2022

1.2 Terms of Reference and Work-Plan & Cash-flow Formulate the ToR and Work-plan & Cash-flow for the Review May, 2022 End of May, 2022

1.3 Review Committee Meetings Conduct Review Committee Meetings Fortnightly from June 2022 - June, 2023 June, 2023

1.4 Consultations and Workshops on the Draft Conduct national and regional consultations and workshops September, 2022 November, 2022

1.5. Certificate of Necessary Letter to State Solicitor for the Certificate of Necessary April, 2023 End of April, 2023

1.6 NEC Endorsement Do a NEC Submission for the Review May, 2023 End of May, 2023

1.7 Certificate of Compliance Letter to the First Legislative Council for the Certificate of Compliance June, 2023 End of October, 2023

1.8 Enactment of the Legislation Table the Audit Bill on the Floor of the Parliament for enactment November, 2023 End of November, 2023
column17: PNG0012 公佈年度審計報告 Publication of Annual Audit Reports
Full Text 中文:
需要解決的問題 審計長辦公室編制了四份年度報告，這些報告以法定機構和國有企業等國家機構及時發布的財務報表為基礎。然而，在過去的幾年裡，這些報告並未依照《審計法》的要求提供。這些機構延後按時提交財務報表。分配給各機構和使用的公共資金不會透過議會審計委員會向議會報告、公佈和提交。

主要目標 對包括法定機關和國有企業在內的國家機構進行財務審計，是為了確保機構在使用公共資金時對其公民負責。這也是為了最大限度地減少公共資金的濫用，並提高政府機構和國有企業的透明度和問責制。

承諾簡介 該承諾主要關注國家和地方各級以及國有企業的服務提供基金分配的公共財政和支出報告。這是審計長對用於營運和資本投資的資金負責的機制。 OGP 透過這項承諾將有助於各部門、法定機構、地方政府和國有企業及時發布財務報表。然後，審計長辦公室將使用財務報表編制四 (4) 份報告；因此，報告對象為：各部門、地方政府、法定機構及國營企業。透過該承諾，議會帳目委員會將能夠開展工作，並透過該委員會向議會提供審計報告。

承諾政府部門/機構和其他附屬機構沒有及時向財政部提交財務報表，然後提交審計長辦公室進行審計並向議會提交，從而導致巴布亞新幾內亞的年度審計報告沒有及時向公眾公佈。準確及時地提供財政數據，以便該國的公民和利益相關者必須了解資金如何流入以及資金如何流出該國。這包括及時在 AGO 網站和其他政府網站（例如發布年度報告的財政部）上向公眾公佈年度審計報告。

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。進行財務審計是為了了解國家和國家以下各級公共資金的管理情況，並讓政府更好地分析下一個預算，以有效提供服務。同樣重要的是，保持巴布亞新幾內亞作為 OGP 成員的資格，使巴布亞新幾內亞能夠在該地區的治理問題上發揮領導作用。

野心 簡要描述承諾的預期結果，以及如何使政府更加開放或透過更加開放來改善政府。年度財務審計和審計報告的公佈將使接受公共資金的機構能夠改善公共資金的使用，從而提高問責制。

里程碑 活動說明 開始日期 結束日期

第一階段－發布財務報表和製作年度審計報告

1.1 財務報表 各部門、法定機構、地方政府及國營企業按時向審計長辦公室發布財務報表 2022年4月及2024年4月 2023年3月及2024年3月出具審計報告

1.2 審計報告 每年出具四部分審計報告 2023年2月及2024年2月 2023年11月及2024年11月

1.3 議會審計委員會取得的審計報告 取得議會審計委員會的審計報告 2023年10月、2024年10月 10月底及2024年10月底

1.4 提交議會表的審計報告 2022 年 11 月、2023 年 11 月和 2024 年 11 月提交議會的所有四份審計報告 2022 年 11 月和 2023 年 11 月

1.5 審計報告的發布 在法定媒體上發布年度審計報告 2022年12月、2023年12月 2023年12月底、2024年12月 

第二階段：審查 1989 年審計法

1.1 審查委員會 設立審計法審查委員會 2022 年 5 月 2022 年 5 月底

1.2 職權範圍、工作計畫和現金流量 制定審核職責範圍、工作計畫和現金流量 2022 年 5 月 2022 年 5 月底

1.3 審查委員會會議 2022年6月至2023年6月每兩週舉行一次審查委員會會議 2023年6月

1.4 關於草案的諮詢和研討會 舉辦國家和區域諮詢和研討會 2022 年 9 月 2022 年 11 月

1.5.必要證明書 致州事務律師的必要證明信 2023 年 4 月 2023 年 4 月底

1.6 NEC 認可 提交 NEC 審核意見 2023 年 5 月 2023 年 5 月底

1.7 合規證明書 致第一屆立法會索取合規證明書的信函 2023 年 6 月 2023 年 10 月底

1.8 立法表的頒布 審計法案提交議會審議 2023 年 11 月 2023 年 11 月底
Lead Institution: Office of the Auditor General
Supporting Institution(s): Department of Finance, Department of Justice and Attorney General, Department of National Planning and Monitoring, Department of Provincial and Local Level Government Affairs, Department of Implementation and Rural Development, National Economic Fiscal Commission, Parliamentary Audit Committee, Institute of National Affairs, Consultative Implementation & Monitoring Council, Centre for Environmental Law and Community Rights

Commitment Title: Access to Information Legislation
Full Text:
Problem/Issue to be addressed The flow of information for public consumption and decision-making is weak in PNG. The agencies within the government, civil society and private sectors are overprotective in sharing information for public benefit due to administrative restrictions. There is no policy or legislation platform that enables the agencies (government, CSO & private sectors) to share public information that are required by organizations and individuals planning and decision-making purposes, for evidence-based policy formulation, investments and general public consumption.

Main Objective The objective of this commitment is to enhance the flow of public information through a legislative framework to enable greater participation of citizens in the management of public affairs. The Access to Information Legislation will address the barriers that limit the flow of information to the citizens and from one agency to another agency or from point A to point B.

Brief Description of Commitment Pursuant to s 51 (1) of the National Constitution, it states that “every citizen has the right of reasonable access to official documents subject only to the need for such secrecy as is reasonably justifiable in a democratic society”. Further in s 51 (3), it states “provision shall be made by law to establish procedures by which citizens may obtain ready access to official information”. The current Access to Information Act will allow citizens to have access to government information. The National Constitution calls for an appropriate legislation to be developed to enable easy accessibility of public information. The Access to Information Legislation will be drafted to be enacted by Parliament to address the flow of information barriers faced in the country.

OGP Challenge address by the Commitment OGP Grand Challenge to be addressed through this Commitment are; ✓ Ease the administrative barriers of the flow of public information. ✓ Establish the legislative framework that will obligate agencies to make available public information for access. ✓ Enable citizens to have access to valuable public information that they have wished to but never accessed before. ✓ Increasing Public Integrity and confidence in the Government Information Systems.

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. “Access to information legislation” is one of the central tenets of the OGP and has become a major driving force in the promotion of access to information reforms worldwide. As a cornerstone for open government platform, the legal right to request information from the government can lead to more open, accountable, and participatory government while the public are required to have laws enabling the fair access to information and could further establish mechanisms through which they can monitor and provide feedback on the right to information system. Any country wishing to participate in OGP needs to meet minimum eligibility requirements, hence access to information directly aligns with PNG Commitment to the OGP membership. This commitment to enact the “Access to Information” legislation and other proposed bills are expected to be key instruments contributing towards transparency and accountability to build more open institutions, and generate useful public knowledge. Furthermore, there are valuable tools to allow for greater engagement of citizens in the management of public affairs.

Ambition Briefly described the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness Since 2011, countries in five continents have included more than 120 access to information commitments in their National Action Plans (NAPs), spanning from legal reforms and capacity building activities to technological developments and dissemination programs. The Access to Information Legislation is expected to be a key instrument contributing towards transparency and accountability to build more open institutions, and generating useful public knowledge. Furthermore, it is a valuable tool to allow for greater engagement of citizens in the management of public affairs. 

Milestones Activity Descriptions Start Date End Date 

Phase 1: Drafting the Legislation

1.1 Drafting Committee Establish a Drafting Committee with a defined term of reference and work plan & cash-flow April, 2022 End of April, 2022

1.2 Drafting Committee Meetings The Drafting Committee meetings as per the work plan April, 2022 September, 2023

1.3 Drafting and Workshops Draft the Access to Information Legislation with interval meetings and drafting workshops May, 2022 June, 2022

1.4 Draft Bill Produce the Draft Bill for stakeholder consultations May, 2022 July, 2022 Phase 2: National and Regional Consultations

2.1 Four regional consultations Conduct four regional stakeholder consultations September, 2022 October, 2022

2.2 National Consultation Conduct a National stakeholder consultation October, 2022 November, 2022

2.3 Consultation Report Formulate the Stakeholder Consultation Report December, 2022 End of December, 2022 

Phase 3: Legal Administrative Process

3.1 Drafting Instruction, NEC Submission and Explanatory Note Formulate the Drafting Instruction, NEC Submission and the Explanatory Note February, 2023 March, 2023

3.2 Certificate of Necessary Letter to State Solicitor with necessary attachments to get the Certificate of Necessary March, 2023 April, 2023

3.3 NEC Endorsement NEC Policy Submission is made with the CoN and other necessary documents to NEC for its endorsement May, 2023 June, 2023

3.4 Certificate of Compliance Letter to First Legislative Council with NEC Decision No#, CoN, and other necessary documents to the First Legislative Council for the Certificate of Compliance July, 2023 August, 2023 

3.5 Enactment of Access to Information Bill into Act Table the Access to Information Bill on the Floor of the National Parliament November, 2023 December, 2023
column17: PNG0013 獲取資訊立法 Access to Information Legislation
Full Text 中文:
需要解決的問題 巴布亞紐幾內亞公共消費和決策的資訊流動薄弱。由於行政限制，政府內部機構、民間社會和私營部門在為了公共利益共享資訊時存在過度保護。沒有政策或立法平台使機構（政府、民間社會組織和私營部門）能夠共享組織和個人規劃和決策所需的公共訊息，以進行基於證據的政策制定、投資和一般公共消費。

主要目標 這項承諾的目標是透過立法架構加強公共資訊的流通，使公民更參與公共事務的管理。資訊取得立法將解決限制資訊向公民流動、從一個機構到另一個機構或從 A 點到 B 點流動的障礙。

承諾簡介 根據《國家憲法》第 51 條第 (1) 款，規定「每個公民都有權合理取得官方文件，但僅需要在民主社會中合理地保密」。此外，第 51 條第 (3) 款規定，「法律應制定規定，建立公民可以隨時取得官方資訊的程序」。現行的資訊取得法將允許公民取得政府資訊。國家憲法要求制定適當的立法，以方便取得公共資訊。議會將起草《資訊取得立法》，以解決該國面臨的資訊流動障礙。

透過承諾解決的 OGP 挑戰 透過本承諾解決的 OGP 大挑戰包括： ✓ 放寬公共資訊流通的行政障礙。 ✓ 建立立法框架，強制各機構提供公共資訊以供取得。 ✓ 使公民能夠存取他們想要但以前從未訪問過的有價值的公共資訊。 ✓ 提高公眾誠信度和對政府資訊系統的信心。

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。 「資訊取得立法」是OGP的核心原則之一，成為推動全球資訊取得改革的主要推手。作為開放政府平台的基石，向政府索取資訊的合法權利可以使政府更加開放、負責和參與，同時要求公眾有法律保障資訊的公平獲取，並進一步建立機制可以對資訊系統的權利進行監控並提供回饋。任何希望參加 OGP 的國家都需要滿足最低資格要求，因此獲取資訊直接符合巴布亞新幾內亞對 OGP 成員資格的承諾。制定「資訊取得」立法和其他擬議法案的承諾預計將成為有助於提高透明度和問責制的關鍵工具，以建立更開放的機構，並產生有用的公共知識。此外，還有一些有價值的工具可以讓公民更參與公共事務的管理。

雄心 簡要描述了承諾的預期結果，以及如何使政府更加開放或通過更加開放改進政府 自 2011 年以來，五大洲的國家在其國家行動計劃 (NAP) 中納入了 120 多項獲取信息的承諾，涵蓋從法律改革和能力建設活動到技術開發和傳播計劃。資訊取得立法預計將成為促進透明度和問責制的關鍵工具，以建立更開放的機構，並產生有用的公共知識。此外，它是讓公民更參與公共事務管理的寶貴工具。

Commitment Title: Digital Government Legislation and Strategy
Full Text:
Problem/Issue to be addressed The e-government legislation addresses key issues in relation to digitalization of government data and information accessibility. Issues are discrepancies in the areas of,
● Electronic Transaction (IFMS)
● Data Protection and Privacy
● Consumer Protection
● Computer Crimes
● Business Competitions
● Taxation and
● Information Security

Main Objective The e-government legislation guides evidence-based policy aimed to transform Manuel processes of government business to deliver public services more effectively and efficiently by digitizing government service delivery mechanism.

Brief Description of Commitment The Digital Government Legislation provides solutions to address government digital information and systems which the cluster is committed to regulate the use of technological communication devices. It offers new opportunities for more direct and convenient citizen access to government and for government provisions of services directly to citizens through a coordinated integrated approach in which electronic data governance is fundamentally the driver of any digitization process.

OGP Challenge address by the Commitment The cluster commitment enables constructive engagement between government and civil society on issues of legislative openness and citizens participation in the legislative process through e-government processes.

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. E-government legislation is the enabler to digitizing government electronic information for accessibility in civic space, accountability for transparency and to harness technology and innovation. It provides guidelines and regulations in which government information available must be cautioned when it is accessed. Policy on the e-government gives citizens a certain extent to involve in the government policy formulation process and keeps the government accountable for transparency and service delivery.

Ambition Briefly described the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness The e-government legislation provides a road map in which government information is digitized and open to citizens for engagement and accessibility. The result is to have a certain degree when accessing government information and how government services can be delivered according to the policy framework. It also protects government information and restricts information that is not worthy for development purposes. 

Milestones Activity Descriptions Start Date End Date 

Phase 1: Drafting the Legislation

1.1 Drafting Committee Establish a Drafting Committee with a defined term of reference and work plan & cash-flow April, 2022 End of April, 2022

1.2 Drafting Committee Meetings The Drafting Committee meetings as per the work plan May, 2022 September, 2023

1.3 Drafting and Workshops Draft the E-government Legislation with interval meetings and drafting workshops May, 2022 May, 2023

1.4 Draft Bill Produce the Draft Bill for stakeholder consultations July, 2022 August, 2022 

Phase 2: National and Regional Consultations 

2.1 Four regional consultations Conduct four regional stakeholder consultations November, 2022 December, 2023

2.2 National Consultation Conduct a National stakeholder consultation February, 2023 End of February, 2023

2.3 Consultation Report Formulate a Stakeholder Consultation Report March, 2023 End of March, 2023

Phase 3: Legal Administrative Process

3.1 Drafting Instruction, NEC Submission and Explanatory Note Formulate the Drafting Instruction, NEC Submission and the Explanatory Note April, 2023 End of April, 2023

3.2 Certificate of Necessary Letter to State Solicitor with necessary attachments to get the Certificate of Necessary June, 2023 End of June, 2023

3.3 NEC Endorsement NEC Policy Submission is made with the CoN and other necessary documents to NEC for its endorsement July, 2023 August, 2023

3.4 Certificate of Compliance Letter to First Legislative Council with NEC Decision No#, CoN, and other necessary documents to the First Legislative Council for the Certificate of Compliance September, 2023 October, 2023

3.5 Enactment of Access to Information Bill into Act Table the E-government Legislation Bill on the Floor of the National Parliament November, 2023 End of November, 2023

"Problem/Issue to be addressed This new technology cluster has a number of issues to be addressed due to our slow advancement in the E-government reforms. These issues include the adaptation of a rapidly evolving international, economic, social, technological and cultural environment. The issue of protecting and advancing democracy, strengthening social and economic development, ensuring environmental sustainability and managing technological challenges in new ways to earn the public's trust.

Main Objective E-Government Policy enables digital government services to transform into an inclusive digital society where all citizens can benefit from the opportunities offered by digital technologies to improve quality of life. The e-Government Policy establishes a policy platform in which a number of legislations, strategies and programs will be derived to enhance the digital transformation system in the country. It also optimizes service delivery that provides universal access to government information and services anytime and anywhere.

Brief Description of Commitment The Commitment focuses on the formulation of the e-Government Policy to establish a policy platform to enhance digital transformation. This commitment is the use of technological communications devices, such as computers and internet, to provide public services to citizens. E-government Policy offers new opportunities for more direct and convenient citizen access to government, and for government provision of services directly to citizens. The Digital interaction between a citizen and the government, between governments and other government agencies, between government and citizens, between government and employees and between government and businesses.

OGP Challenge address by the Commitment The commitment addresses significant challenges of the government in relation to information dissemination, lack of accountability and transparency, bureaucracy and lack of citizen participation in domestic institutions and processes. Moreover, lack of stakeholder involvement, coordination, information sharing, ICT literacy and e-Government awareness are considered to be the major obstacle. The policy presents an opportunity to the ICT Sector for a major transformation in the digital space.

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. The technological development has turned the government policies and strategies towards e-government. The e-government is considered the primary tool to facilitate the access of the citizen to various services thus the government plans and subsidies shall reach the public through e-government portal.Furthermore, the e-government policy gives easy access to government information and development agendas, keeps accountable when information is readily available and accessible. It encourages more civic participation as technology harnesses information on the government budget and expenditure report.

Ambition Briefly described the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness The intended result of the commitment is to improve transparency in the government system and processes. E-government minimizes redundant information flow, helps to eliminate duplication of functions and improves the adherence of public servants to proper government procedures, thereby reducing opportunities for corruption. The E-government has made information from legislative meeting minutes to budget proposals to map-based information available to the public. It also implies that public processes are becoming more transparent, public information is available online and citizens and non-government organizations are encouraged to interact with public administration through new platform-based forms of participation and collaboration.

3.5 Finalized e-Government Policy Finalize the e-Government Policy November, 2022 January, 2023

3.10 Awareness and implementation Conduct awareness and effectively implement the e-Government Policy October, 2023 March, 2024"
column17: PNG0015 數位政府立法和策略 Digital Government Legislation and Strategy
Full Text 中文:
需要解決的問題/問題 電子化政府立法解決了與政府資料數位化和資訊可近性相關的關鍵問題。問題是以下方面的差異：
● 電子交易（IFMS）
●資料保護和隱私
● 消費者保護
● 電腦犯罪
●商業競賽
● 稅金和
●資訊安全

主要目標 電子化政府立法指導實證政策，旨在透過數位政府服務提供機制，轉變政府業務流程，更有效、有效率地提供公共服務。

承諾簡介數位政府立法提供了解決政府數位資訊和系統的解決方案，該集群致力於規範技術通訊設備的使用。它為公民更直接、更方便地接觸政府以及政府透過協調一致的綜合方法直接向公民提供服務提供了新的機會，其中電子數據治理從根本上是任何數位化進程的驅動力。

承諾的 OGP 挑戰演講 集群承諾使政府和民間社會能夠就立法開放性和公民透過電子化政府流程參與立法過程等議題進行建設性接觸。

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。電子化政府立法是政府電子資訊數位化的推動者，以實現公民空間的可近性、透明度問責制以及利用技術和創新。它提供了指導方針和規定，其中規定在訪問可用的政府資訊時必須注意這些資訊。電子化政府政策使公民在一定程度上參與政府政策制定過程，並使政府對透明度和服務提供負責。

雄心 簡要描述了該承諾的預期結果，以及如何使政府更加開放或通過更加開放來改進政府。其結果是在獲取政府資訊以及如何根據政策框架提供政府服務時有一定程度的要求。它還保護政府資訊並限制不值得開發的資訊。

「問題/需要解決的問題 由於我們電子化政府改革進展緩慢，這個新技術集群有許多需要解決的問題。這些問題包括適應快速變化的國際、經濟、社會、技術和文化環境保護和推動民主、加強社會和經濟發展、確保環境永續性以及以新方式應對技術挑戰以贏得公眾信任的問題。

主要目標電子化政府政策使數位政府服務能夠轉變為包容性的數位社會，所有公民都可以從數位技術提供的機會中受益，從而改善生活品質。電子化政府政策建立了一個政策平台，其中將衍生出許多立法、策略和計劃，以加強國家的數位轉型系統。它還優化了服務交付，使人們可以隨時隨地存取政府資訊和服務。

承諾簡介 該承諾的重點在於制定電子化政府政策，建立促進數位轉型的政策平台。這項承諾是利用電腦和互聯網等技術通訊設備為公民提供公共服務。電子化政府政策為公民更直接、更方便地接觸政府以及政府直接向公民提供服務提供了新的機會。公民與政府之間、政府與其他政府機構之間、政府與公民之間、政府與員工之間、政府與企業之間的數位互動。

承諾應對 OGP 挑戰 該承諾解決了政府在資訊傳播、缺乏問責制和透明度、官僚主義以及缺乏公民參與國內機構和程序等方面面臨的重大挑戰。此外，缺乏利害關係人的參與、協調、資訊共享、資訊通信技術素養和電子化政府意識被認為是主要障礙。該政策為資訊通信技術產業提供了數位空間重大轉型的機會。

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。科技的發展使政府政策和策略轉向電子化政府。電子化政府被認為是便利公民獲得各種服務的主要工具，因此政府計劃和補貼應透過電子化政府入口網站傳達給公眾。訪問時保持責任。隨著技術利用政府預算和支出報告的信息，它鼓勵更多的公民參與。

目標 簡要描述該承諾的預期結果以及如何使政府更加開放或透過更加開放來改善政府 該承諾的預期結果是提高政府系統和流程的透明度。電子化政府最大限度地減少冗餘資訊流，有助於消除職能重複，提高公務員遵守適當政府程序的程度，從而減少腐敗機會。電子化政府已向公眾提供從立法會議紀要到預算提案再到基於地圖的資訊。它也意味著公共程序變得更加透明，公共資訊可以在線上獲取，並鼓勵公民和非政府組織透過基於平台的新參與和協作形式與公共管理互動。

Commitment Title: Monitoring and Reporting on the Budget Expenditure
Full Text:
Problem/Issue to be addressed The country’s expenditure reporting is very weak. The successive Governments have failed to improve the Budget Expenditure Reporting in the country. There is a fragmented reporting system. There is no legislation that empowers the agencies such as Departments of National Planning and Monitoring and Treasury to legally demand the agencies to report on their expenditures. The financial expenditures have not been disclosed for public access and the political leaders and the head of agencies were not held accountable. The monetary value of goods and services have not reflected the monetary value. The agencies that receive capital investment budget failed to report on their spending. Even though there are suspicious of misuse but there is lack of comprehensive investigations.

Main Objective The objective of the Commitment is to improve transparency and accountability in the budget implementation and reporting processes. This is to making sure leaders being accountable to the citizens. The discloser of expenditure report is important to ensure there is correspondence between the money budgeted and spent in that budgeted item.

Brief Description of Commitment This commitment will enable the Department of National Planning and Monitoring and the Department of Treasury to monitor the implementation of the Budget (both capital and operational) and report to the citizen through the National Parliament and publication through media outlet annually. This will be enabled by the enactment of the Planning and Monitoring Responsibility Act which calls for all state agencies to report on the implementation of their respective programs and the projects. Those reports will be consolidated and published annually through media outlets.

OGP Challenge address by the Commitment The compulsory expenditure reporting will enable agencies to:
• Improve weakness in budget expenditure reporting mechanisms
• Make leaders and head of agencies accountable to the citizens
• Improve service delivery
• Improve weakness in the Governance process
• Promote performance-based budgeting
• Ensuring value for money is reflected on the ground

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. The commitment will enhance the agencies’ capacities to accurately and timely report on the budget implementation. The reported expenditure reports will then be published after tabling on the Floor of the National Parliament. This process promotes Good Governance, Accountability, transparency, Government integrity and making Government responsive to citizens’ needs which are the objectives of the OGP.

Ambition Briefly described the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness This commitment aims to promote monitoring and reporting on the budget expenditure that makes Government accountable and build investor confidence. This commitment will lead to improving financial management practices within Government departments/agencies.

column17: PNG0016 預算執行透明度立法 Legislation for Budget Implementation Transparency
Full Text 中文:
問題/需要解決的問題 該國的支出報告非常薄弱。歷屆政府未能改善該國的預算支出報告。存在一個分散的報告系統。沒有立法授權國家規劃和監測部以及財政部等機構依法要求這些機構報告其支出。財政支出尚未對外公開，政治領袖和機構負責人也沒有被追究責任。商品和服務的貨幣價值並未反映貨幣價值。接受資本投資預算的機構未能報告其支出狀況。儘管有濫用的嫌疑，但缺乏全面的調查。

主要目標 此承諾的目標是提高預算執行和報告流程的透明度和問責制。這是為了確保領導人對公民負責。支出報告的揭露者對於確保預算項目中的預算資金和支出之間的對應關係非常重要。

承諾簡介 該承諾將使國家規劃和監測部以及財政部能夠監控預算（資本和營運）的執行情況，並每年透過國民議會向公民報告並透過媒體發布。這將透過《規劃和監督責任法》的頒布來實現，該法要求所有國家機構報告各自計劃和專案的實施情況。這些報告將每年透過媒體進行整合和發布。

OGP 挑戰承諾的解決方案 強制支出報告將使各機構能夠：
• 改善預算支出報告機制的弱點
• 讓領導者和機構負責人對公民負責
• 改善服務交付
• 改善治理流程中的弱點
• 促進以績效為基礎的預算編制
• 確保物有所值能實際體現

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。這項承諾將增強各機構準確、及時報告預算執行的能力。報告的支出報告將在提交國民議會審議後公佈。這個過程促進良好治理、問責制、透明度、政府誠信，並使政府回應公民的需求，這也是 OGP 的目標。

雄心 簡要描述該承諾的預期結果，以及如何使政府更加開放或透過更加開放來改善政府。這項承諾將改善政府部門/機構內的財務管理實務。

Commitment Title: Establishment of EITI Commission
Full Text:
The Issues and challenges that the Commitment is trying to address OGP challenges this commitment attempts to address include: Lack of transparency in the extractive industry payments (taxes, royalties) from both government and developers.
✓ Lack of civil society voice in the extractive sector.
✓ Lack of contract transparency.
✓ Lack of accountability and public participation.
✓ Lack of access to data.
✓ Confidence and sustainability of the existence the EITI in PNG
As a result of this commitment, the EITI Secretariat will be now established as a Commission with defined functions and responsibilities.

The main Objectives of the Commitment By June 2022, the EITI Commission Bill shall be enacted and the EITI Commission will be established thereafter

Brief Description of the Commitment PNG is an Extractive Industry Transparency Initiative (EITI) candidate country. In 2013, the National Executive Council (NEC) endorsed the implementation of the EITI in PNG. Since then, PNG has produced seven (2014-2020) consecutive annual reports. The report in each year has its own recommendations which were considered when formulating the following years report. The administrative issues and other crucial issues surrounding data are being addressed through endorsement of the EITI Policy and the legislations will be pursued soon.

OGP Grand Issues and Challenges the Commitment will address Whilst PNG has successfully completed its seven EITI Report since 2013, major challenges remain surrounding administration. EITI Secretariat needs to graduate itself into a Commission and establish by an Act of Parliament. The OGP Platform will facilitate the establishment of the EITI Commission with defined functions that are independent and unlikely to be influenced politically.

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation, and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. (A detailed description of these values is available in the OGP Values Guidance Note.) The establishment of the EITI Commission with defined functions by an Act of Parliament will confidence and certainty that the EITI Reports will be continuously produced with bottlenecks and political influences. The civil society, private sector, development partners and government will be engaged through a validate the Reports and carryout other reforms in the extractive sector.

Ambition Briefly describe the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness. The establishment of the EITI Commission with establishment pathway that minimize political influences and improve sustainability and public confidence 

Milestones Activity Descriptions Start Date End Date 

Phase 1: Corporate Plan

1.1 Committee Establish a Committee to formulate a Corporate Plan and facilitate the establishments of the EITI Commission May, 2022 May, 2022

1.2 Formulation of Corporate Plan Formulates the Corporate Plan May, 2022 August, 2022

1.3 Launch of the Corporate Plan Launch the Corporate Plan August, 2022 August, 2022 

Phase 2: Staffing of the Commission

2.1 Restructure Design a Restructure for the EITI Commission September, 2022 September, 2022

2.2 Publication of Restructure Advertise the restructure October, 2022 October, 2022

2.3 Recruitment Undertake the recruitment of Staff for the Commission November, 2022 November, 2022

2.4 Capacity Building Offer trainings for the new Officers and also their stationaries December, 2022 December, 2022

這項承諾試圖解決的問題和挑戰包括： 政府和開發商在採礦業付款（稅收、特許權使用費）方面缺乏透明度。
✓ 採礦業缺乏民間社會的聲音。
✓ 合約缺乏透明度。
✓ 缺乏問責性和公眾參與。
✓ 無法存取資料。
✓ 巴布亞紐幾內亞 EITI 存在的信心和永續性
作為這項承諾的結果，EITI 秘書處現將成立為一個具有明確職能和職責的委員會。

承諾的主要目標 到 2022 年 6 月，將頒布 EITI 委員會法案，隨後將成立 EITI 委員會

承諾簡介 巴布亞紐幾內亞是採礦業透明度倡議 (EITI) 候選國。 2013 年，國家執行委員會 (NEC) 批准在巴布亞紐幾內亞實施 EITI。此後，巴布亞紐幾內亞已連續發布七份年度報告（2014年至2020年）。每年的報告都有自己的建議，在製定下一年的報告時會考慮這些建議。與數據有關的管理問題和其他關鍵問題正在透過 EITI 政策的認可得到解決，並且很快就會尋求立法。

OGP 承諾將解決的重大問題和挑戰 雖然巴布亞紐幾內亞自 2013 年以來已成功完成七份 EITI 報告，但圍繞管理仍面臨重大挑戰。 EITI 秘書處需要升級為一個委員會，並根據議會法案建立。 OGP 平台將促進建立 EITI 委員會，該委員會具有獨立且不太可能受到政治影響的明確職能。

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。 （這些價值觀的詳細描述可在 OGP 價值觀指導說明中找到。）根據議會法案建立具有明確職能的 EITI 委員會，將增強 EITI 報告在遇到瓶頸和政治影響的情況下持續生成的信心和確定性。民間社會、私營部門、發展夥伴和政府將參與驗證報告並在採礦業進行其他改革。

雄心 簡要描述承諾的預期結果以及它將如何使政府更加開放或透過更開放來改善政府。建立 EITI 委員會，其建立途徑可最大限度地減少政治影響並提高永續性和公眾信心

Commitment Title: Enactment of EITI Reporting Legislation
Full Text:
Issues OGP is trying to address During the implementation of the first OGP NAP 2018-2020, the following issues were raised;
✓ Agencies being protective over their data, hence not willing to share.
✓ Certain legislations limit their ability to share data
✓ Difficult to access total revenue for respective companies
✓ Difficult accessing Agreements

Main objective The main objective of commitment is to enable flow of information within the extractive industry through a legislative platform

Brief Description of the Commitment EITI legislation will enhance the effectiveness of reporting from private sectors as well as state agencies operating in the Extractive Industry. During the past 8 years of collecting data/statistics for the production of Report, PNG saw a need to draft a legislation to empower effective production and reporting of the EITI Information. In the 2nd NAP under the Extractive Resource Transparency, the EITI Reporting legislation will be development to elevate the reporting process.

Issues and Challenges The EITI Policy was formulated and endorsed by Cabinet in 2019 which calls for the enactment of the EITI Commission and the EITI Reporting Legislations. There is uncertainty for EITI Secretariat given that another NEC Decision can revoke the existing NEC Decision and disband the Secretariat

Relevance Briefly describe the way in which this commitment is relevant to further advancing OGP values of access to information, public accountability, civic participation, and technology and innovation for openness and accountability. (A detailed description of these values is available in the OGP Values Guidance Note.) The EITI Reporting Legislation will provide a legal platform for the reporting aspect of the Extractive Industry. It will enable the EITI Commission to access the required data easily and boost participation in data sharing.

Ambition Briefly describe the intended results of the commitment and how it will either make government more open or improve government through more openness. The EITI Legislation will reduce the communication and data sharing barriers in the extractive industry. The legislative will authorize the EITI Commission to have access to data in the extractive space.

1.4 Consultations Undertake regional and national consultations July, 2022 October, 2022

1.5 Explanatory Note, and Consultation Report Formulate the Explanatory Note and Consultation Report October, 2022 November, 2022

column17: PNG0021 EITI 報告立法的頒布 Enactment of EITI Reporting Legislation
Full Text 中文:
OGP 試圖解決的問題 在實施第一個 OGP NAP 2018-2020 期間，提出了以下問題；
✓ 各機構對其資料進行保護，因此不願意共享。
✓ 某些立法限制他們共享資料的能力
✓ 難以取得各公司的總收入
✓ 難以取得協議

主要目標 承諾的主要目標是透過立法平台實現採礦業內部資訊的流動

承諾簡介 EITI 立法將提高私營部門以及採礦業國家機構報告的有效性。在過去 8 年為製作報告收集數據/統計數據期間，巴布亞紐幾內亞認為有必要起草一項立法，以授權有效製作和報告 EITI 資訊。在採礦資源透明度下的第二次國家行動計畫中，將制定 EITI 報告立法以提升報告流程。

問題和挑戰 EITI 政策於 2019 年由內閣制定並批准，要求頒布 EITI 委員會和 EITI 報告立法。鑑於另一項 NEC 決定可以撤銷現有的 NEC 決定並解散秘書處，EITI 秘書處存在不確定性

相關性 簡要描述這項承諾與進一步推進 OGP 價值觀的相關方式，這些價值觀包括資訊取得、公共責任、公民參與以及開放和問責的技術和創新。 （這些值的詳細說明可在 OGP 值指導說明中找到。）EITI 報告立法將為採礦業的報告方面提供一個法律平台。它將使 EITI 委員會能夠輕鬆存取所需數據並促進數據共享的參與。

雄心 簡要描述承諾的預期結果以及它將如何使政府更加開放或透過更開放來改善政府。 EITI 立法將減少採礦業的通訊和資料共享障礙。立法機構將授權 EITI 委員會存取採礦領域的資料。

Commitment Title: Ley de Accesso a la Información Pública
Short Title: Law on Access to Public Information
Full Text:
El Estado paraguayo asumió compromisos internacionales y nacionales13 en lo relacionado al acceso a la información pública. Con el objetivo de contar con un marco normativo robusto en la materia, en el 2014 se sanciona y promulga la Ley Nº 51 89 “Que e stablece la obligatoriedad de la provisión de informaciones en el uso de los recursos públicos sobre remuneraciones y otras retribuciones asignadas al ser vidor público de la República del Paraguay”, y se trata en el Congreso Nacional la reglamentación del artículo 28 de la Constitución Nacional “Del derecho a informarse”.
En consecuencia, el compromiso a ser asumido en el marco de la AGA, será el de la promulgación e imple mentación de la Ley de “Libre Acceso Ciudadano a la Información Pública y Transparencia Gubernamental”, con lo cual se definirán estánda res y mecanismos de acceso a la información pública , la regula ción de plazos de respuesta y establecimiento de s anciones al incumplimiento de los mismos.

Commitment Title: Mecanismos de transparencia y anticorrupción
Full Text:
Mecanismos de transparencia y anticorrupción 
  Institución responsable de la implementación 
 Poder Ejecutivo, Poder Legislativo 
 ¿Cuál es la problemática que el compromiso aborda? 
 A la entrada del nuevo Gobierno se abordaron temas estratégicos como ejes prioritarios en la política de estado y una de ellas es la lucha contra la corrupción, el lavado de dinero, el financiamiento del terrorismo, el crimen organizado.
 Se vio la necesidad de impulsar y proyectar las reformas normativas necesarias para prevenir, detectar y sancionar la corrupción, procurando sintonía entre los poderes del estado bajo un objetivo en común. 
 ¿Cuál es el compromiso? 
 Impulsar las reformas legales necesarias para prevenir, detectar y sancionar la corrupción. El objetivo fundamental es la búsqueda de mecanismos preventivos donde se incorporen estrategias, acciones entre el poder ejecutivo y el poder legislativo, a fin de disminuir los focos de corrupción y la prevención en las instituciones públicas.
 ¿Cómo contribuirá a resolver la problemática?
 Con este compromiso se busca generar instituciones más fortalecidas, sólidas y transparentes en su gestión, garantizando a la población que pueda apropiarse de una cultura de transparencia y anticorrupción esto les va a permitir profundizar sobre los diversos mecanismos de transparencia y anticorrupción disponibles, a efecto de generar mayor auditoria social y vigilancia sobre la gestión pública.
 Visualizar los avances y desafíos, así como propuestas concretas para el abordaje de uno de los ejes más importantes de este gobierno que es la lucha contra la corrupción y la realización de las medidas preventivas sobre casos y posibles casos de corrupción
 ¿Por qué es relevante a los valores de OGP? 
 La iniciativa es relevante a los valores de OGP, por la vinculación de poderes del estado bajo un mismo objetivo, con este compromiso se pretende lograr la participación ciudadana generando espacios de dialogo sobre estos temas que preocupan a la sociedad y lograr que la ciudadanía se encuentre involucrados en el proceso legislativo de cada proyecto de ley. 
 Información adicional
 Este compromiso es la vinculación y la articulación de esfuerzos institucionales de dos poderes del estado, otros organismos y de las organizaciones civiles para cumplimiento al Objetivo 16 de Desarrollo Sostenible (Paz. Justicia e instituciones sólidas), en armonía con los ejes prioritarios del gobierno nacional, el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo y la articulación de esfuerzos para adoptar recomendaciones realizadas por organismos internacionales.
 La presentación de las siguientes leyes abajo más detalladas dará un paso importante a la política pública más arriba citado.

 新政府的戰略主題是國家政治和反腐敗、貨幣洗錢、恐怖主義金融和犯罪組織的優先事項。

Commitment Title: Manual de rendición de cuentas
Full Text:
Manual de rendición de cuentas 
 Actor responsable de la implementación 
 Secretaría Nacional Anticorrupción (SENAC)
 
 ¿Cuál es la problemática que el compromiso aborda? 
 La falta de un Decreto por el cual se implementa en las Instituciones del Poder Ejecutivo el Manual de Rendición de Cuentas hace que solo pocas instituciones lo adopten e implementen.
 
 ¿Cuál es el compromiso? 
 Elaboración de un anteproyecto de decreto por el cual se declara de interés y se dispone el Uso del Manual de Rendición de Cuentas para las Instituciones del Poder Ejecutivo.
 
 ¿Cómo contribuirá a resolver la problemática?
 Ante la falta del acto administrativo por excelencia del Poder Ejecutivo el Decreto, el manual solo es implementado por algunas Instituciones; con un decreto toda la órbita del Poder Ejecutivo estaría implementando el Manual, la información de todas las instituciones llegaría al ciudadano en un formato amigable y comprensible, y se darían las condiciones para que el ciudadano pueda participar en el control de la gestión pública.
 
 ¿Por qué es relevante a los valores de OGP?
 Contar con un Decreto por el cual se implementa el Manual de Rendición de cuentas en las institucionales permitirá visibilizar por parte del ciudadano el aporte de cada institución al desarrollo económico y social del país, facilitando el escrutinio público de las decisiones que se realizan en el sector público. Este compromiso es de gran relevancia considerando que la mayor demanda en el sector público se encuentra en la órbita del Poder Ejecutivo.
 
 Información adicional
 El Paraguay cuenta con un Plan Nacional de Desarrollo fue aprobado por Decreto Nº 2794/14 conforme al mandato constitucional establecido en el Artículo 177 que establece que “Los planes nacionales de desarrollo serán indicativos para el sector privado, y de cumplimiento obligatorio para el sector público” cuyos ejes estratégicos son 1- Reducción de pobreza y desarrollo social 2- Crecimiento económico inclusivo 3- Inserción de Paraguay en el mundo estableciendo como línea transversal la Gestión pública transparente y eficiente.

Commitment Title: Presentation of the organic law creating SENIT
Short Title: Creating the National Secretariat for Integrity and Transparency (SENIT)
Short Title 中文: 創建國家誠信和透明度秘書處 (SENIT)
Full Text:
Brief description of the commitment: Submit a bill "Creating the National Secretariat for Integrity and Transparency (SENIT)" to the National Congress. 

What is the problem that the engagement seeks to address? The National Anticorruption Secretariat (SENAC) was created by Executive Decree No. 10,144 of 2012, which was followed by another amending Decree that expanded the powers of this Secretariat. According to the decrees, it is an institution under the Presidency of the Republic of Paraguay, responsible for developing, promoting and implementing public policies on transparency, integrity and anti-corruption, whose scope of application are those State Agencies and Entities (OEE) under the Executive Branch, as well as those institutions outside the Executive Branch that have signed an agreement with SENAC. Likewise, SENAC is entrusted with coordinating and articulating all these measures with all sectors of society, in the understanding that the fight against corruption is approached in a systemic manner. The lack of a legal norm creating SENAC and containing its powers and attributions generates a lack of involvement of the other OEEs and other sectors of society that are relevant in the fight against corruption to achieve better and sustainable results. 

What is the commitment? To present the bill that will have as its main purpose that the National Secretariat for Integrity and Transparency (SENIT) replaces the National Anticorruption Secretariat (SENAC) as the guiding institution responsible for elaborating, promoting and implementing public policies of transparency, integrity and the fight against corruption in the agencies of the Executive Branch, the central administration of the State, the entities of the decentralized public administration, public companies and joint ventures, and to corporations in which the State is a majority shareholder. The patrimony, assets, and financial resources, as well as the personnel of SENAC will belong to SENIT. 

How will you contribute to solving the problem? The projected regulations contemplate all the powers and functions in the fight against corruption, whether for prevention or management of complaints, the use of digital tools, as well as the need to coordinate policies with other government agencies and entities and the power to enter into cooperation agreements. 

Why is it relevant to OGP values? Accountability is part of one of the schemes already addressed by SENAC within the framework of the fight against corruption and as a mechanism for citizen participation par excellence. The bill establishes the following roles and powers of SENIT: Promote awareness and citizen participation actions. Promote prevention and compliance actions in the private sector.

Additional information The proposed Commitment is linked to the following Plans: National Development Plan Paraguay 2030 - PND 2030 Strategic Axis Transversal lines AXIS 4. POLITICAL AND INSTITUTIONAL STRENGTHENING B- EFFICIENT AND TRANSPARENT PUBLIC MANAGEMENT 4.2. Modernizing Public Administration NDP 2030 Institutional Policy Program and Project National Integrity, Transparency and Anticorruption Plan 2021-2025 AXIS 1: PREVENTIVE CAPACITY OF THE STATE IN THE FACE OF ACTS OF CORRUPTION STRATEGY 2.7 - Consolidate the internal control system (MECIP) in each of the State Agencies and Entities. 72. Promote regulations that establish criteria of suitability and integrity to occupy positions of responsibility. Sustainable Development Goal 2030 - SDG 2030 SDG16. PEACE, JUSTICE, AND STRONG INSTITUTIONS SDG17. PARTNERSHIPS TO ACHIEVE THE GOALS

column17: PY0071 創建國家誠信和透明度秘書處 (SENIT) Creating the National Secretariat for Integrity and Transparency (SENIT)
Full Text 中文:
承諾簡述：向國會提交「創建國家誠信和透明度秘書處（SENIT）」法案。 

此次合作旨在解決什麼問題？國家反腐敗秘書處 (SENAC) 根據 2012 年第 10,144 號行政令設立，隨後又頒布了另一項修訂令，擴大了該秘書處的權力。根據該法令，它是巴拉圭共和國總統轄下的一個機構，負責制定、促進和實施有關透明度、廉正和反腐敗的公共政策，其適用範圍為巴拉圭共和國下屬的國家機構和實體（OEE）。以及行政部門以外與SENAC 簽署協議的機構。同樣，SENAC 也負責與社會各界協調和闡明所有這些措施，並理解以系統方式打擊腐敗。由於缺乏創建 SENAC 並包含其權力和歸屬的法律規範，導致其他 OEE 和社會其他部門缺乏參與反腐敗鬥爭，以取得更好和可持續的結果。 

承諾是什麼？提出該法案，其主要目的是國家誠信和透明度秘書處（SENIT）取代國家反腐敗秘書處（SENAC），成為負責制定、促進和實施透明度、誠信和反腐敗公共政策的指導機構打擊行政部門機構、國家中央行政機構、分權公共行政機構、上市公司和合資企業以及國家佔多數股東的公司中的腐敗行為。 SENAC的遺產、資產、財務資源以及人員將屬於SENIT。 

您將如何為解決問題做出貢獻？預計的法規考慮了反腐敗鬥爭中的所有權力和職能，無論是預防還是管理投訴、數位工具的使用，以及與其他政府機構和實體協調政策的必要性以及開展合作的權力協議。 

為什麼它與 OGP 值相關？問責制是 SENAC 已在反腐敗框架內解決的計劃之一的一部分，也是公民參與的卓越機制。該法案規定了 SENIT 的以下角色和權力： 促進意識和公民參與行動。促進私部門的預防和合規行動。

其他資訊 建議的承諾與以下計劃相關： 巴拉圭 2030 年國家發展計劃 - PND 2030 戰略軸 橫向線軸 4。公共管理現代化 NDP 2030 機構政策計劃和項目 2021-2025 年國家廉潔、透明度和反腐敗計劃 軸 1：國家面對腐敗行為的預防能力 戰略 2.7 - 鞏固每個國家的內部控制系統 (MECIP) 國家機構和實體。 72. 推動制定規定，確定擔任責任職位的適當性和誠信標準。 2030 年永續發展目標 - SDG 2030 SDG16。和平、正義和強有力的機構 SDG17。實現目標的夥伴關係

Commitment Title: Preparation of the preliminary draft of the Law regulating lobbying activities (Lobby Law)
Full Text:
Brief description of the commitment: Following the international recommendations regarding the alignment to legal standards related to the regulation of public integrity indicated in the National Integrity, Transparency and Anticorruption Plan (PNI 2021-2025), the need to work on the drafting of a bill to regulate lobbying activities was identified, for its official presentation to the Executive Branch. 

What is the problem that the engagement seeks to address? According to the International Standards for Lobbying Regulation report, the purpose of lobbying regulations is to ensure that there is transparency about the impact of lobbying on decision-making processes, as well as accountability for the policies and laws that are adopted. Lobbying regulation should seek to create a more level playing field, allowing all actors to participate in the decision-making process on an equal footing, and specific mechanisms need to be in place to prevent potential conflicts of interest from influencing the decision-making process. It is also important to note that regulation is only one of the elements that a strategy to ensure fairlobbying must include: compliance with any regulation, but also the willingness of all actors involved to behave ethically, will be crucial to foster an environment where lobbying and decisions on public affairs are carried out ethically and fairly. Lobbying is a legitimate activity and an important aspect of the democratic process. There is a significant public interest in ensuring the transparency and integrity of lobbying, as well as diversity in participation and contribution to decision-making processes on public issues. The standard is a pending matter for the Republic of Paraguay, which requires, in accordance with the vision of the National Integrity, Transparency and Anti-Corruption Plan (PNI 2021- 2025), the implementation of a regulatory framework that covers this dimension within the framework of the promotion of public ethics in the country. 

What is the Commitment? Draft bill regulating lobbying activities, for its official presentation to the Executive Branch. 

How will you contribute to solving the problem? The proposal consists of drafting a bill to address the lack of regulation of lobbying activities in Paraguay, to promote compliance with the systemic anti-corruption agenda established in the National Integrity, Transparency and Anti-Corruption Plan, Axis 4 Framework for the Control of Public Procurement and the Internal Control and Risk Systems, Objective 4.7. Regulation of conflicts of interest and lobbying activities, Action 4.7.3. 

Why is it relevant to OGP values? The regulation aims precisely at defining principles, concepts and procedures that make the management of lobbying in Paraguay transparent. The exercise of accountability is the central goal of the proposed regulation, with the incorporation of procedures and records of public access, which guarantees citizen control of the management of state employees in this area. The incorporation of clear rules will allow public servants to be governed by them and to document their activities to report them. The incorporation of a regulation on lobbying will allow citizens to have direct access to the management of authorities and public servants in relation to lobbying activities carried out by interest groups with these actors, which will allow greater control by citizens as a way of safeguarding the public interest.

Additional information The proposed Commitment is linked to the following Plans: National Development Plan Paraguay 2030 - PND 2030 Strategic Axis Transversal lines AXIS 4. POLITICAL AND INSTITUTIONAL STRENGTHENING B- EFFICIENT AND TRANSPARENT PUBLIC MANAGEMENT 4.2. Modernizing Public Administration NDP 2030 Institutional Policy Program and Project National Integrity, Transparency and Anticorruption Plan 2021-2025 AXIS 1: PREVENTIVE CAPACITY OF THE STATE IN THE FACE OF ACTS OF CORRUPTION STRATEGY 2.7 - Consolidate the internal control system (MECIP) in each of the State Agencies and Entities. 72. Promote regulations that establish criteria of suitability and integrity to occupy positions of responsibility. 承諾簡述：根據國家廉正、透明度和反腐敗計劃（PNI 2021-2025）中指出的關於符合公共廉正監管相關法律標準的國際建議，需要起草一項法案確定了規範遊說活動的規則，並將其正式提交給行政部門。 

此次合作旨在解決什麼問題？根據《遊說監管國際標準》報告，遊說監管的目的是確保遊說對決策過程的影響的透明度，以及對所採用的政策和法律的問責制。遊說監管應尋求創造更公平的競爭環境，讓所有參與者平等參與決策過程，並需要建立具體機制來防止潛在的利益衝突影響決策過程。同樣重要的是要注意，監管只是確保公平遊說的策略必須包括的要素之一：遵守任何監管，而且所有參與者都願意遵守道德規範，這對於營造一個遊說和遊說的環境至關重要。的決策是在道德和公平的情況下進行的。遊說是合法活動，也是民主進程的重要面向。確保遊說的透明度和完整性以及公共問題決策過程參與和貢獻的多樣性符合公眾的重大利益。該標準對於巴拉圭共和國來說是一個懸而未決的問題，巴拉圭共和國要求根據國家廉正、透明度和反腐敗計劃（PNI 2021-2025）的願景，在國家內部實施涵蓋這一方面的監管框架。的框架。 

什麼是承諾？規範遊說活動的法案草案，正式提交給行政部門。 

您將如何為解決問題做出貢獻？該提案包括起草一項法案，以解決巴拉圭遊說活動缺乏監管的問題，促進遵守國家廉正、透明度和反腐敗計劃、軸 4 公眾控制框架中製定的系統性反腐敗議程。 ，目標4.7。利益衝突與遊說活動監管，行動 4.7.3。 

為什麼它與 OGP 值相關？該法規的目的正是在於定義原則、概念和程序，使巴拉圭的遊說管理變得透明。問責制的行使是擬議法規的中心目標，納入了公共訪問的程序和記錄，保證了公民對該領域國家僱員管理的控制。納入明確的規則將使公務員受其管轄，並記錄其活動並進行報告。納入遊說法規將使公民能夠直接接觸當局和公務員的管理，並了解利益集團與這些行為者進行的遊說活動，這將允許公民更好地控制，作為保護公眾的一種方式興趣。

Commitment Title: Transporte Urbano de Lima y Callao con espacios participativos y colaborativos que contribuyan a la Gobernanza y el funcionamiento de la Autoridad de Transporte Urbano - ATU.
Short Title: Urban Transport of Lima and Callao with Participatory and Collaborative Spaces That Contribute to the Governance and Operation of the Urban Transport Authority - ATU.
Short Title 中文: 利馬和卡亞俄的城市交通具有參與性和協作性空間，有助於城市交通管理局（ATU）的治理和運作。
Full Text:
9.	Transporte Urbano de Lima y Callao con espacios participativos y colaborativos que contribuyan a la Gobernanza y el funcionamiento de la Autoridad de Transporte Urbano - ATU.
2017 – 2019
Institución responsable de la implementación	Ministerio de Transportes y Comunicaciones 
Descripción del compromiso
¿Cuál es la problemática que el compromiso aborda?	La sobreposición de rutas, la informalidad, transitabilidad desordenada, congestión vehicular y contaminación son parte de la problemática que afronta la Ciudad de Lima y Callao, debido principalmente, entre otros, a la falta de coordinación entre los actores y actoras, lo que dificulta la gestión del tránsito y su gobernanza.
¿Cuál es el compromiso?	El Ministerio de Transportes y Comunicaciones promoverá la generación de espacios participativos y colaborativos que permitan a la futura Autoridad de Transporte Urbano (ATU) recoger los aportes de las Organizaciones de la Sociedad Civil, Academia, Empresa y Cooperantes e instituciones públicas para contribuir a la Gobernanza en el Transporte Urbano y su funcionamiento.

De esta forma se busca crear espacios de discusión y el fortalecimiento de los instrumentos que permitan crear las condiciones para avanzar en la reforma del transporte urbano en Lima y Callao, considerando como un factor importante el cambio de patrones de conducta de los usuarios del transporte que han modelado sistemas ineficientes.
¿Cómo contribuirá a resolver la problemática?	El compromiso representa una oportunidad para la ciudadanía y representantes de la sociedad civil para participar y colaborar con la Autoridad de Transporte Urbano en la solución de la problemática del transporte en Lima y Callao; y su involucramiento en los procesos de implementación, seguimiento y evaluación de la reforma del transporte. 

Asimismo, el compromiso busca sensibilizar a las autoridades de Lima y Callao y Congreso de la República para fortalecer la gobernanza de la ATU.

La elaboración de los Estudios de la Autoridad de Transporte Urbano realizados durante el año 2016 y I semestre 2017, los avances en la creación de la Autoridad de Transporte Urbano (Proyecto de Ley remitido al Congreso de la República en Julio de 2017), y en la propuesta de Política Nacional de Transporte Urbano, así como las iniciativas para la implementación de sistemas integrados de transporte en corredores de la Municipalidad Metropolitana de Lima, constituyen un punto favorable.
¿Por qué es relevante a los valores de OGP?	El compromiso es relevante frente a la participación cívica debido a que ofrece a la ciudadanía la oportunidad de participar en el proceso de implementación y seguimiento de las acciones que realice la ATU.
El compromiso también resulta relevante sobre la rendición de cuentas debido a que da la oportunidad a la Autoridad de Transporte Urbano de acercarse a la sociedad civil y rendir cuenta de sus acciones.
Información adicional 	El compromiso se enmarca en el:
- Proyecto TRANSPERU NAMA de Transporte Urbano Sostenible que tiene las 6 Políticas que propone acciones para desarrollar un transporte sostenible, bajo en carbono y la mitigación de gases de efecto invernadero.
-  Política Nacional de Transporte Urbano
-  Estrategia para apoyar a los Gobiernos Locales 
-  El Programa Presupuestal 0148: Reducción del tiempo, inseguridad y costo ambiental en el transporte urbano
